0.title: Beautiful & blessed: Suriya on completing 25 yrs in film industry
0.article_body: Tamil actor Suriya Sivakumar has completed 25 years in the film industry. On Tuesday, the actor took to Twitter to celebrate the milestone and tweeted, "Truly a beautiful and blessed 25 years. Dream and believe." Suriya, who made his debut with the 1997 release 'Nerukku Ner', has acted in around 50 films so far.

1.title: Revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 crore released to 14 states
1.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday released the sixth instalment of the Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) grant to 14 states, totalling ₹7,183 crore. The PDRD grants, released as per the recommendations of the 15th Finance Commission, are given to the states under Article 275 of the Constitution to meet the gap in revenue accounts of the states post devolution.

2.title: 2 Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists killed in encounter in J&K
2.article_body: Two Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Poshkreeri area of J&K's Anantnag on Tuesday. Following a tip-off, a cordon-and-search operation was launched by security forces. "Both were involved in...killing of one Territorial Army personnel Saleem on April 9, 2021, and killing of two civilians on May 29, 2021, in Jablipora," said ADGP Kashmir.

3.title: Female US news anchor suffers stroke on live TV, video surfaces
3.article_body: A US news anchor was seen fumbling her words and stopping mid-sentences while reading a news report live on air as she started to show early signs of a stroke. Julie Chin suffered the "beginnings of a stroke" on TV on September 3. She said during the broadcast, "I'm sorry, something's going on with me this morning...I apologise to everybody."

4.title: PWD issues flood alert along Cauvery river banks in TN's Salem
4.article_body: Public Works Department officials on Tuesday raised a flood alert in Tamil Nadu's Salem. As PWD decided to discharge surplus water from Stanley reservoir in Mettur dam in Salem, it asked people living on the banks of the Cauvery river to move to safer places. Mettur dam is receiving water from Karnataka, which has been experiencing heavy rains since Sunday.

5.title: K'taka govt proposes sluice gates for B'luru lakes to prevent flooding
5.article_body: The Karnataka government is considering the construction of sluice gates for all Bengaluru lakes to regulate water overflow during heavy rains and to prevent flooding in catchments around lakes. Several parts of the city are waterlogged after heavy rainfall. "This was the highest rainfall in the last 42 years," CM Basavaraj Bommai said.

6.title: For God's sake, stop trolling Arshdeep, we should support our team: Ayushmann
6.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana took to Instagram and defended pacer Arshdeep Singh who was trolled for dropping a catch during India versus Pakistan Asia Cup match on Sunday. "For God's sake, stop trolling Arshdeep. He's a great prospect," he wrote, adding, "Let's not be fickle and fair weather. We should support our team even when they lose a close one."

7.title: 97% of Puneites willing to buy EVs to fight air pollution: Survey
7.article_body: A survey by Clean Mobility Collective, India, has found that around 97.2% of respondents in Pune were willing to buy electric vehicles to fight air pollution and mitigate climate change. According to the survey, 84.5% of respondents attributed last-mile delivery vehicles as one of the reasons for rising air pollution in the cities. The survey was conducted among 1,508 respondents.

8.title: Fire breaks out at private buses workshop in Gurugram, 3 buses burnt
8.article_body: As many as three buses were gutted in a fire that broke out at a private buses workshop in Gurugram. The fire also affected the slum areas which were near the workshop. Firefighters, along with two fire engines, were rushed to the spot and it was brought under control. We controlled the fire quickly, said Dinesh Kumar, a fire officer.

9.title: Russia's VTB Bank launches transfers in Chinese yuan bypassing SWIFT
9.article_body: VTB Bank on Tuesday said it has become the first Russian bank to launch money transfers to China in yuan without using the international messaging system SWIFT. Western countries had cut-off Russian banks from SWIFT in March over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Maximum amount of a single money transfer is equivalent to 20 million roubles (approx $3,28,677), VTB Bank said.

10.title: Liz Truss officially takes over as UK PM
10.article_body: Liz Truss officially took over as UK's new Prime Minister on Tuesday after meeting Queen Elizabeth at Balmoral Castle. Truss, who defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race, is the third woman Prime Minister of the United Kingdom after Margaret Thatcher and Theresa May. Earlier, Boris Johnson tendered his resignation to the Queen at the Balmoral Castle.

11.title: Highest corruption allegations in T'gana: BJP MP on KCR's free electricity remark
11.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday announced "free power supply to all farmers in the country if non-BJP government comes to power in 2024", BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri criticised KCR. "Highest corruption allegations are in Telangana," Dharmapuri said.  "They said they'll give free 24/7 electricity to farmers, but the power supply is only for 7-8 hours," he added.

12.title: 3 killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, region's guv says
12.article_body: Three civilians were killed by Russian shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv region in the last 24 hours, the region's governor said on Tuesday. The strikes destroyed a private residential building in Kharkiv city, killing a 73-year-old woman, the official informed. The remaining casualties were reported in a village north of Kharkiv where two men reportedly died amid shelling.

13.title: 3 Naxalites, including a woman, surrender in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
13.article_body: Three Naxalites, including a woman, surrendered before the police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) in Chhattisgarh's Sukma on Tuesday, police said. The woman, Madkam Hidme, was the vice-president of Jantana Sarkar in Bijapur, while Punem Kanna was a member of the Naxal's doctor committee and Karam Sukku was the vice-president of Peddagalur Jantana Sarkar in Bijapur, an official said.

14.title: She's like a doormat, different from the person I am: Swara on 'Jahaan...' role
14.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said her character in her upcoming movie 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar' is "like a doormat". "Her greatest fear is that her husband will get angry, her pet lines are 'Let me ask him'," she added. "It's very different...from the person I am...I don't remember having to ask for permission to do anything in my life," said Swara.

15.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar meets Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi
15.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in the national capital on Tuesday. Taking to Twitter, Kejriwal said that they discussed many serious issues including 'Operation Lotus', horse-trading of MLAs by "these people" to topple elected governments and the increasing corruption of BJP governments. Kumar is in Delhi to unify the Opposition ahead of the 2024 general elections.

16.title: 5 of family killed, 1 injured as car hits electric pole in Ludhiana
16.article_body: Five members of a family were killed and one person was injured after their car crashed into an electric pole in Ludhiana on Tuesday, police said. The accident occurred when they were returning to Ludhiana after attending a family function in Chandigarh. The deceased were identified as 40-year-old Rajesh Kumar, his 5-year-old daughter Jasmine, 30-year-old Sanjna and her two daughters.

17.title: All-rounder for all seasons, welcome to next season of life: Gambhir on Raina
17.article_body: After Suresh Raina announced his retirement from all formats of cricket on Tuesday, ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter and wrote, "An all-rounder for all seasons! Welcome to the next season of life!" India opener Shubman Gill tweeted, "Your contribution to the game of cricket is invaluable. Good luck on your second innings Raina bhai."

18.title: Congress shares video of Tejasvi 'enjoying' dosa amid B'luru floods
18.article_body: Congress spokesperson Lavanya Ballal on Tuesday shared a video of BJP MP Tejasvi Surya eating masala dosa at an eatery in Bengaluru. "Surya was enjoying a good breakfast while [Bengaluru] was drowning. Has he visited even a single flood affected region?" Ballal tweeted. "After watching [an Instagram reel], I'm here...to try out this...dosa," Surya was heard saying in the video.

19.title: CISF cover provided to protect RSS offices; bizarre: Jairam
19.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has criticised the Centre for allegedly providing armed CISF cover to RSS offices in Delhi. "3000 CISF posts at airports to be abolished and replaced by private security. But CISF [given] to protect 'Humare Do' and RSS facilities," Ramesh said. He added, "Private for public assets and public for private entities. Bizarre!"

20.title: 3 farmers die by suicide in Nagpur in 2 days over crop failure
20.article_body: Three marginal farmers died by suicide in Maharashtra's Nagpur district in separate incidents due to crop failure and indebtedness in two days, police said. Vitthalrao Umarkar, 62, and Krishna Sayam, 36, were reportedly found hanging in Ambada and Tanda villages of Nagpur district, respectively. Another farmer, Ashok Sarwe, 35, died after allegedly consuming poison in Umri village.

21.title: TN Police forms teams to monitor rumours being spread on social media
21.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police has formed teams to keep a check on those spreading rumours on social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook. Comprising 203 police officers, the 'Social Media Committees' will ensure no clashes arise from cast, religious and political animosity. The teams have been formed across nine cities, including Chennai, and 37 districts across the state.

22.title: German Prez asks for forgiveness over 1972 Munich Olympics attacks
22.article_body: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier asked for forgiveness for country's failure to protect 11 Israeli athletes at the 1972 Munich Olympics. "I am ashamed...I ask for forgiveness for insufficient protection of the athletes, for insufficient resolution of this matter," Steinmeier said. A German policeman and five Palestinian gunmen also died during a standoff at the Olympic village.

23.title: Hong Kong reports its first case of monkeypox
23.article_body: Hong Kong reported its first case of monkeypox on Tuesday, health authorities said. A 30-year-old man who arrived in Hong Kong from the Philippines after travelling in the US and Canada showed symptoms of monkeypox. Hong Kong, which has so far not reported any local cases of monkeypox, will now raise the response level for the outbreak to 'alert' level.

24.title: Swiss police find 23 migrants, including Indians, crammed into a van
24.article_body: Switzerland police on Monday found 23 migrants crammed into the windowless cargo area of a delivery van during a traffic check on a highway. The migrants, aged between 20 and 50, were from India, Afghanistan, Syria and Bangladesh, police said, adding that the driver of the van has been arrested. The migrants were trying to travel to other European countries.

25.title: Youth, women to be given priority in ticket distribution for Guj polls: Cong leader
25.article_body: The Congress party will give priority to youth and women in ticket distribution for the Gujarat Assembly polls, party leader Ramesh Chennithala said on Tuesday. "This time, we will give priority to new faces, youth and women in ticket distribution. Our list of candidates for the Gujarat polls this time will be an impressive one," Chennithala said.

26.title: 900 kg of adulterated paneer worth ₹1.98 lakh seized in Pune
26.article_body: Pune Food and Drug Administration (FDA) raided an illegal factory in Manjari Khurd in the city and seized around 900 kilograms of adulterated paneer, estimated to be worth ₹1.98 lakh, an official said. The Assistant Commissioner at the Pune FDA, Sanjay Naragude, said that skimmed milk powder and  RBD Palmolein oil worth ₹2.24 lakh were also seized from the factory.

27.title: Canada extends manhunt to nab suspect in mass stabbing that killed 10
27.article_body: Canada's largest manhunt launched to trace the only surviving suspect involved in a stabbing incident, which led to ten deaths, extended into its third day. Hundreds of police officers are looking for 30-year-old Myles Sanderson, who is reportedly armed and dangerous. Police suspect that Sanderson may have killed his 31-year-old brother Damien, another suspect in the stabbing incident.

28.title: One catch doesn't define a player's role, we're all with Arshdeep: Dhawan
28.article_body: India opener Shikhar Dhawan has tweeted in support of pacer Arshdeep Singh, who was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in the Asia Cup on Sunday. "One catch does not define a player's role...We're all with you Arshdeep. You have a long and glorious career ahead. Go and win India more games. You're unstoppable," wrote Dhawan.

29.title: Nitish Kumar is on political tourism in Delhi: Sushil Modi
29.article_body: Former Deputy CM of Bihar Sushil Kumar Modi said that the state's Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is on a political tour in the national capital while the people of Bihar have been facing a flood. "The Lok Sabha election is approaching so Nitish Kumar has come to Delhi on political tourism," the Rajya Sabha MP said.

30.title: Python enters BJP MLA's house during public meeting, video surfaces
30.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a python can be seen entering BJP MLA Rahul Bachha Sonkar's house in UP during a public meeting. In the 8-second video clip, the python can be seen coiling itself near the door of Bilhaur MLA Sonkar's house. After the snake's appearance, Uttar Pradesh Forest Corporation was informed about the incident.

31.title: Viral video appears to show Harry Styles spitting on Chris Pine during film's premiere
31.article_body: The video of an interaction between Harry Styles and Chris Pine at the premiere of 'Don't Worry Darling' has gone viral. In the clip, Styles supposedly "appears to spit" on Pine while taking his assigned seat next to the actor, who then looks down at his lap and stops clapping. However, some viewers have dismissed the spitting claim.

32.title: Pics of 'rainbow ice caves' in US go viral, authorities say they can be 'deadly'
32.article_body: The US National Park Service (NPS) issued an advisory to people visiting Washington's Mount Rainier National Park after a photographer's pictures showing 'rainbow ice caves' there went viral. Officials "strongly discourage" people from entering the caves, the NPS said, adding, "They are prone to spontaneous collapse." It said, "Collapse or ice and rock fall could be fatal."

33.title: Which are the world's 10 most valuable unicorn startups as per Hurun?
33.article_body: TikTok owner Douyin Group (formerly called ByteDance) is the world's most valuable unicorn startup with a valuation of $200 billion, as per Hurun Global Venture Capitalists 2022 Half-Year Report. It is followed by Elon Musk-led SpaceX ($125 billion) and Jack Ma's Ant Group ($120 billion). The list of most valuable unicorns includes Stripe, Shein, Binance, Databricks, WeBank, JDT and Checkout.com.

34.title: Yatra can achieve both 'Bharat jodo', 'Congress jodo': Shashi Tharoor
34.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' could achieve both "Bharat jodo" and "Congress jodo" as it could also unite Congressmen and women across the country around the party's values and ideals as well as service to the people. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is one important contribution to this ongoing effort, he told PTI.

35.title: Siddique Kappan mastermind at evading police: UP govt tells SC
35.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has asked the Supreme Court to reject journalist Siddique Kappan's bail plea. "The accused is a mastermind at evading police," the government said in an affidavit. It accused Kappan of suppressing facts, destroying electronic evidence and propagating activities of the Popular Front of India (PFI) under the garb of journalism.

36.title: Specially-abled man electrocuted by live wire hanging from open box in Thane
36.article_body: A 29-year-old man was electrocuted by a live wire protruding from an open electricity Distribution Point (DP) in Thane on Monday. The incident took place when the deceased, Vijay Bodade, who was sleeping outside the house, woke up and went for a walk. Half asleep, he came in contact with the live wires from the open electricity box and died.

37.title: 6 arrested for attacking Muslim cab driver in Hyderabad
37.article_body: Six people were reportedly arrested after a Muslim cab driver was attacked in Hyderabad. As per reports, a group of unidentified men allegedly forced him to say 'Jai Shree Ram' when he was on his way to pick up a passenger. The man alleged that when he refused to chant 'Jai Shree Ram', they attacked his car with boulders.

38.title: Villagers lock up sarpanch for not holding gram sabha in Maha's Latur
38.article_body: Villagers in Maharashtra's Latur district on Tuesday locked their sarpanch inside the panchayat office for not holding a gram sabha for two and a half years. Datta Gaikwad, sarpanch of Katgaon village, was reportedly released after he promised to hold a gram sabha on Thursday. According to Block Development Officer Tukaram Bhalke, a probe has been initiated into the matter.

39.title: Police detain 35 mafia suspects in hunt for Italy's top fugitive
39.article_body: Italian police have arrested 35 people in a series of raids against suspected mafia members. The operation is part of a broader investigation aimed at capturing Sicilian mafia boss Matteo Denaro, who has been on the run since 1993, police said. Denaro is wanted over the 1992 murders of two anti-mafia prosecutors and 1993 bombings in Florence, Rome and Milan.

40.title: Markets end flat with Sensex down 49 points, Nifty at 17,650
40.article_body: Benchmark indices ended flat on Tuesday amid volatility. Sensex was down 48.99 points to end at 59,196.99, while Nifty lost 10.20 points to close at 17,655.60. Bharti Airtel, NTPC, Apollo Hospitals, Cipla, SBI Life and RIL were the top gainers, while stocks of Tata Consumer Products, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, UPL, Britannia, Kotak Bank and Mahindra & Mahindra slipped.

41.title: Mercedes-Benz launches investigation into accident that killed Mistry
41.article_body: Mercedes-Benz has launched an investigation into the road accident that killed former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and involved one of its GLC cars. A team from Mercedes-Benz visited the accident site and collected the vehicle's data to analyse details such as the car's tyre pressure and brake fluid level. The accident took place in Palghar on Sunday.

42.title: TMC stages dharna against release of convicts in Bilkis Bano rape case
42.article_body: Trinamool Congress' women wing launched a 48-hour-long dharna in Kolkata to protest against the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case. They called the decision shameful and unacceptable. “The law of the country says that when remission is considered for any prisoner, those punished for rape are not to be considered,” said TMC leader Shashi Panja.

43.title: Lufthansa pilots to go on strike again for higher wages: Union
43.article_body: Pilots of the passenger and cargo divisions of the German airline Lufthansa will hold a strike again over a wage dispute, Vereinigung Cockpit (VC) said on Tuesday. The pilots' association VC is demanding a 5.5% rise in pay this year. Passenger pilots will strike on Wednesday and Thursday while cargo pilots will strike from Wednesday to Friday.

44.title: Sisodia lays foundation stone of flyover at Delhi's Sarai Kale Khan
44.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday laid the foundation stone of a three-lane flyover at Sarai Kale Khan to ease traffic movement from ITO to Ashram. "The flyover will be ready in one year," Sisodia added. It'll cause reduction in carbon emissions by five tonnes daily and save ₹19 crore of public money every year, Sisodia further said.

45.title: 80% work of geo-mapping 900 kindergartens in Mumbai completed: BMC
45.article_body:
The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) stated around 80% work of geo-mapping Mumbai's 900 kindergartens has been completed. "The survey will help us...identify if there is a need for a nursery school depending on the ward's population," BMC joint commissioner said.
The survey will also help to know if there's proper infrastructure and basic amenities like drinking water and toilets.

46.title: Gold worth PKR 20 mn stolen from Pak jeweller's bag during flight: Report
46.article_body: Gold worth PKR 20 million was stolen from a Pakistani jeweller's cabin baggage during a flight from Dubai to Karachi, a media report said. Mohammad Moonis reportedly lost 1,542 grams of gold on Sunday afternoon. The Airport Security Force (ASF) had conducted a scanning of all passengers after the flight landed in Karachi, but the stolen gold wasn't recovered.

47.title: Sameer Khetarpal appointed as CEO and MD of Jubilant FoodWorks
47.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, the firm that operates fast-food chains like Domino's Pizza and Dunkin' Donuts, appointed Sameer Khetarpal as the new CEO and MD. In a statement, the company said that shareholders have also approved the appointment in the 27th Annual General Meeting. Khetarpal's earlier stint was with Amazon where he scaled businesses like Amazon Fresh, Amazon Foods and Amazon Pharmacy.

48.title: Ayan, Alia, Ranbir to host 'Brahmastra' screening for fans on Sept 8
48.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Alia Bhatt shared a video along with 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji and actor Ranbir Kapoor in a movie theatre. In the video, Alia revealed that they are watching 'Brahmastra' for the first time. Ayan further said that they will hold a special premiere with fans on September 8 and watch the film with the audience.

49.title: Congress govt's 'maladministration' is why B'luru is suffering: CM Bommai
49.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai accused the previous Congress governments in Karnataka for the present situation of Bengaluru. "This happened because of maladministration and totally unplanned administration of previous Congress government. They never thought of maintaining the lakes," he said. Administration is working round the clock to tackle the waterlogging problem, the CM added.

50.title: MP man dresses in wife's clothes to steal ₹1.25 lakh, valuables; arrested
50.article_body: A man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh for allegedly dressing up in his wife's clothes and stealing ₹1.25 lakh and some valuables from another man's house. The CCTV footage showed a man dressed in a woman's clothes. Reports said that the police first suspected it to be a eunuch but later found out that the accused was a man.

51.title: Allow free travel to passengers above 75 in Mumbai's BEST buses: BJP leader
51.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming BMC election, BJP leader Pravin Chheda has written to Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis to allow passengers over 75 years of age to travel for free in Mumbai's BEST buses. "Most senior citizens are dependent. If they are allowed free travel, it will help them," Chheda, who is also a former BEST committee chairman, said.

52.title: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank IPO gets fully subscribed on day 2
52.article_body: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's maiden public issue got fully subscribed 1.01 times on Tuesday, the second day of subscription. According to BSE data, the retail category was overbooked 2.11 times, non-institutional investors 0.83 times and qualified institutional bidders 0.73 times as of 10:35 am. The issue size was reduced to 87.12 lakh shares from 1.58 crore shares after anchor book response.

53.title: Male colleagues would 'moo' when I used lactation room: Goldman Sachs ex-MD
53.article_body: Goldman Sachs' former Managing Director Jamie Fiore Higgins revealed she was forced to quit her 17-year-old job in 2016 after facing discrimination at the American bank. Higgins said her male colleagues would 'moo' when she went to the lactation centre. She further said a boss told her she'd never make managing director if she was "pumping milk instead of working".

54.title: If I have choice between Karthik & Pant, then Karthik gets my vote: Manjrekar
54.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said if he had a choice between Dinesh Karthik and Rishabh Pant for the lower-middle order slot, then he would choose Karthik. "There is something Karthik is doing right of late...on current form, I think he gets my vote," stated Manjrekar. "Pant is still searching for that perfect formula to become an impact player," he added.

55.title: Have nothing to hide, did my job honestly: Sisodia amid ED raids
55.article_body: Hours after ED carried out searches in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy case, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said he has nothing to hide and did his job "honestly". If ED officers come to my place, they'll only find maps of some schools, Sisodia added. Notably, around 30 locations across various states including Delhi and Telangana are being raided.

56.title: Priyanka urges people to join Bharat Jodo Yatra, says want to solve problems
56.article_body: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra urged people to join party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is slated to cover a distance of around 3,500 km. “We are starting a positive politics. We want to hear from you, we want to solve your problems. We want to unite our beloved country. Let’s unite India together,” said Priyanka.

57.title: Kejriwal to start nationwide tour for 'Make India No 1' campaign tomorrow
57.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that he'll begin his nationwide tour as part of 'Make India No 1' campaign from his birthplace Hisar in Haryana tomorrow. He said that it's the "dream" of 130-crore people to see India become "the best country". However, he said that the country can't progress until every child receives quality education for "free".

58.title: CBI questions TMC MLA Paresh Pal in murder of BJP worker in Kolkata
58.article_body: The CBI questioned TMC MLA Paresh Pal in connection with its investigation into the murder of BJP worker Abhijit Sarkar in post-poll violence in Kolkata. “We have specific questions for Pal in connection with the murder of Sarkar. These questions have been framed after grilling a few others,” a CBI officer said.

59.title: Are citizens lower priority?: Tharoor on armed CISF cover to RSS offices
59.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday questioned the Centre's decision to abolish over 3,000 CISF posts at airports while RSS offices in Delhi have been provided with an armed CISF cover. "So, tax-paying citizens who are passengers in public airports are a lower priority for CISF deployment than a private non-governmental organisation?" Tharoor tweeted.

60.title: Can resolve all problems with PM Modi at helm in India: B'desh PM
60.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, who is on a four-day visit to India, said on Tuesday that India and Bangladesh can resolve all their problems as long as PM Narendra Modi is at the helm. "Our main aim is to develop the economy and fulfil the basic needs of our people. With friendship, you can solve any problem," PM Hasina said.

61.title: 5 of family, including 3 kids, killed as car overturns in Ludhiana
61.article_body: At least five members of a family, including three kids, were killed after the car they were travelling in overturned on the Ludhiana-Chandigarh highway. The accident took place when the driver lost control and the car hit a wall before overturning. Among the deceased, two were aged five, one was aged three, one was aged 35 and another 30.

62.title: DreamFolks shares list at premium, gain 56% from IPO price
62.article_body: DreamFolks Services shares on Tuesday listed at a premium of 56% above their issue price at ₹508 apiece on the NSE from the initial public offering (IPO) price range of ₹308-326. On the BSE, the stock began trading at ₹505 a share, a premium of 54.9%. The ₹562-crore IPO of the airport service aggregator was subscribed 56.7 times last month.

63.title: Taimur, Jeh should respect that woman of the house also works: Kareena
63.article_body: Speaking about Taimur and Jeh, actress Kareena Kapoor Khan said they have to grow to understand that both of their parents work so that they can have a good life. "They should respect that the woman of the house also works. They should know...their mother...goes to work...This is how my boys will have to be brought up," she added.

64.title: Instagram user calls Cobra's screenplay 'confusing', director says 'sorry'
64.article_body: Ajay Gnanamuthu, writer-director of the recently released movie 'Cobra' starring Vikram, responded to an Instagram user who said the film's screenplay was quite confusing. Ajay replied, "Firstly sorry that you felt confused!! But me as an audience I've always liked watching mind-bending films and genuinely tried it this time!! If possible [please] try watching it again hopefully you like it."

65.title: Virat shouldn't say such things in middle of Asia Cup: Madan Lal
65.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's remark that no one texted him except MS Dhoni when he left Test captaincy, ex-India all-rounder Madan Lal said that the 33-year-old shouldn't make such comments in the middle of the Asia Cup. "Even if someone calls or doesn't call, if you're in trouble you have to work on it...Ego shouldn't clash here," stated Lal.

66.title: Greta criticises Swedish politicians for ignoring climate crisis during polls
66.article_body: Climate activist Greta Thunberg criticised Swedish politicians for ignoring climate crisis before September 11 election. Thunberg pointed out that the issue had been "pretty much non-existent...we have been completely focusing on other things" during the election campaign. She cited Pakistan's example, where monsoon rains and melting glaciers triggered floods, affecting 33 million people.

67.title: 5 Shiv Sena workers tear down BJP banners in Mumbai, booked
67.article_body: The Mumbai Police have registered a case against five Shiv Sena workers for allegedly tearing down banners put up by BJP workers in the Lower Parel area of the city, officials said on Tuesday. BJP workers had put up the banners in the run-up to the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections and the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

68.title: India adopted leadership role in fight against climate change: Union Minister
68.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Tuesday said India has adopted a leadership role in the fight against climate change with its climate actions exceeding its moral and legal responsibility. Developed countries are progressing at the cost of their developing counterparts, Yadav said and added that India has contributed only around 4% of global cumulative emissions since pre-industrial era.

69.title: India is biggest market for exports from B'desh across Asia: PM
69.article_body: Addressing a joint press briefing with his Bangladeshi counterpart Sheikh Hasina, PM Narendra Modi said, "Across Asia, India is the biggest market for exports from Bangladesh." "To further expedite this progress, we will soon initiate discussions on a bilateral economic comprehensive partnership agreement," PM Modi added. Notably, Bangladesh PM Hasina began her four-day visit to India on Monday.

70.title: Solomon Islands calls Aus' offer to fund election 'inappropriate'
70.article_body: The Solomon Islands government said it appreciates Australia's offer to fund next election but the timing is "inappropriate". Australia extended the offer after the Solomon Island's PM Manasseh Sogavare said that authorities cannot fund the Pacific Games and an election in the same year. "This is an assault on our parliamentary democracy," the Solomon Islands government said in a statement.

71.title: DreamFolks Services records Q1 profit at ₹13.4 cr, revenue up 545%
71.article_body: Airport service aggregator DreamFolks Services recorded consolidated net profit for the June quarter at ₹13.43 crore, compared to a loss of ₹1.38 crore in the corresponding period last year. The total revenue surged to ₹160.46 crore, which is a 545.47% jump from last year. The company got listed on the BSE and NSE at a premium of 56% on Tuesday.

72.title: Pressure is on India, this could also be Pakistan's year in Asia Cup: Sehwag
72.article_body: Ahead of India's Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against Sri Lanka, Virender Sehwag said, "If India lose another match, they'll be out of...Asia Cup." He added, "Pakistan have the advantage because if they lose one match and win another, their net run rate will take them to the final...pressure is on India...This could also be Pakistan's year."

73.title: Over 30 Telangana students fall ill, allege dead lizard found in food
73.article_body: Over 30 students of a government-run girls' hostel in Telangana's Warangal fell ill after having dinner. Reports said that one of the students alleged that she saw a dead lizard in the food but that the catering staff said it was a green chilli. Students reportedly started vomiting soon after. Officials said that they have ordered an inquiry.

74.title: Hungary to create anti-graft body in an attempt to unlock EU funds
74.article_body: To oversee the spending of European Union funds, Hungary will create an anti-corruption authority and a working group involving non-government organisations. The move is aimed at unlocking funds as the Hungarian government is facing a stand-off with Brussels over corruption, migration and other issues. Hungary has been awaiting European Commission's approval to draw on money to lift its economy.

75.title: Narayana Hrudayalaya stock rises to 4-month high amid acquisition plan
75.article_body: A day after Narayana Hrudayalaya announced plans to acquire a 100-bed orthopaedic and trauma hospital at Bengaluru's Narayana Health City campus for ₹200 crore, the shares of the hospital chain surged more than 5% to a four-month high of ₹744 apiece on Tuesday. The shares of the Bengaluru-based company were trading at ₹720 apiece at 3:07 pm.

76.title: Fawad Khan, former cricketer Wasim Akram to star in 'MBG'
76.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan is all set to share screen space with former cricketer Wasim Akram in a film titled 'Money Back Guarantee' (MBG). The actor took to Instagram on Tuesday to announce the project. Fawad, who was recently seen in 'Ms. Marvel', has also worked in several Bollywood films, including 'Kapoor & Sons', 'Khoobsurat' and 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil'.

77.title: CPI leader D Raja praises Nitish Kumar, says time to fight unitedly
77.article_body: CPI Leader D Raja hailed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for breaking ties with BJP and for trying to unite the Opposition for 2024 Lok Sabha polls. “Time has come that all secular democratic parties, Left parties, and regional parties must come together and fight unitedly to defeat BJP in the interest of the country and its future,” said Raja.

78.title: Hindu right-wing groups involved in terrorist activities: Ex-RSS worker
78.article_body: A former Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker has alleged that Hindu right-wing groups such as RSS, Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal are engaged in terrorist activities for BJP's political gain. He has also moved an application before the Nanded court, claiming that a VHP leader was directly involved in the Nanded blast case.

79.title: Video shows 3 kids sitting in moving car's boot in Hyd; police take action
79.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video showing three children, including a girl, sitting in the boot of a moving car in Hyderabad and tagged the concerned authorities. The kids were playing with a toy, while adults accompanying them were sitting on the seats. After seeing the video, the Cyberabad Traffic Police verified it and issued a challan.

80.title: Rich nations pledge $25 bn to help Africa adapt to climate change
80.article_body: Rich countries will provide $25 billion to Africa by 2025 to help the continent adapt to climate change, according to officials at a climate summit. President of the African Development Bank, Akinwumi A Adesina, told DW News that Africa is distressed by climate change. "Africa will need $1.3-$1.6 trillion this decade to implement climate goals" Adesina said at the summit.

81.title: Kohli shares 'Notice people' quote amid controversy over 'No one messaged me' remark
81.article_body: Amid controversy over his remark that none of his former teammates barring MS Dhoni messaged him after he quit Test captaincy, Virat Kohli shared a quote on Instagram. The quote read, "Notice the people who are happy for your happiness, and sad for your sadness. They're the ones who deserve special places in your heart." "Word," Kohli captioned the post.

82.title: Google advises users to update Chrome browser to avoid hacking risk
82.article_body: Google has advised its users to quickly install a security update in its Chrome browser to safeguard themselves against a bug being actively exploited by hackers. We're aware that an exploit for 'CVE-2022-3075' exists in the wild, Google added. "Access to bug details and links may be kept restricted until majority of users are updated with a fix," Google said.

83.title: Modernise all govt schools in one go, take states on board: Kejriwal to PM
83.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday urged PM Modi to modernise all government schools across the country instead of doing it in instalments. Kejriwal also urged Centre to take state governments on board in formulating a plan for the same. His comments came after PM Modi announced PM-SHRI Yojana to develop 14,500 schools as model schools, equipped with modern infrastructure.

84.title: No non-teaching duties for teachers: Maharashtra CM Shinde
84.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that no non-teaching duties, except for work which is of national importance, will be assigned to teachers in the state. "I have been receiving a number of complaints and applications regarding non-educational work being assigned to teachers," he added. "Instructions regarding the same will be given to the department," Shinde further said.

85.title: Call 112 or tag us on Twitter to report unmanned barricades: Delhi Police
85.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday told the High Court that people can either dial 112 or tweet tagging the Delhi Traffic Police (@dtptraffic) and Delhi Police (@delhipoliceon) to report any unmanned barricades on the roads in the national capital. Police informed the court that no barricades on roads would be left unattended and ensured immediate action on such complaints.

86.title: 11 persons cheated of ₹2 cr in investment fraud in Mumbai, 1 held
86.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a software engineer, 34-year-old Kishan Katnhar, and booked two others for allegedly cheating 11 investors of over ₹2 crore on the pretext of giving huge returns on their investment. According to the complainant, 28-year-old Mohammed Irfan Khan, along with his family members invested over ₹92 lakh with the accused between November 2016 to December 2017.

87.title: Iran demands closure of IAEA probe for revival of 2015 nuclear deal
87.article_body: Tehran wants the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to drop its probe against Iran's nuclear activities as a guarantee for the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal, the Iranian foreign ministry said on Monday. The US has already rejected linking the IAEA probe with the pact. Uranium traces found at three undeclared Iranian nuclear sites had triggered the probe.

88.title: Stock up supplies, prepare bomb shelters: Ukraine to Crimea residents
88.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have asked residents of Russia-annexed Crimea to prepare bomb shelters and stock up supplies like water and charge power banks. The announcement comes as Kyiv prepares to launch a counteroffensive against Russian troops to drive them out of the Ukrainian territory. Russia annexed Crimea in 2014, however, the territory is still internationally recognised as a part of Ukraine.

89.title: DNA proof submitted against former inspector accused of rape in Hyd
89.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Monday submitted DNA evidence in a Hyderabad court against former Marredpally inspector K Nageswara Rao, who is accused of raping a woman. Opposing Rao's second bail petition, Additional Public Prosecutor Ganga Reddy said that the DNA report shows that Rao committed the crime. Rao allegedly raped a woman whose husband he had arrested in the past.

90.title: India-B'desh relations role model for neighbourhood diplomacy: B'desh PM
90.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, who is on a four-day visit to India, said on Tuesday that India's bilateral relations with Bangladesh are a role model for neighbourhood diplomacy. "I appreciate Modi ji's visionary leadership that continues to provide added momentum to our bilateral relations," she said, adding that India is Bangladesh's most important neighbour.

91.title: Bharat Biotech's nasal COVID vaccine gets emergency use authorisation in 18+ age group
91.article_body: Bharat Biotech's ChAd36-SARS-CoV-S COVID-19 (Chimpanzee Adenovirus Vectored) recombinant nasal vaccine has been approved by the CDSCO for primary immunisation against COVID-19 in 18+ age group for restricted use in emergency situation. It is India's first nasal vaccine for COVID-19. Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted, "Big boost to India's fight against COVID-19!"

92.title: TikTok denies breach after hacker group claims 2 billion users' data stolen
92.article_body: TikTok has denied claims of any data breach after a hacking forum said it had accessed the data of over 2 billion users. The hacker forum had claimed that it had accessed 790GB worth of user data, platform statistics, code, and more. A TikTok spokesperson asserted that its team "found no evidence of a security breach".

93.title: Web series on Rajiv Gandhi's assassination in the works
93.article_body: A web series based on former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination is in the works. Titled 'Trail of an Assassin', it'll be made using inputs from 'Ninety Days: The True Story of the Hunt for Rajiv Gandhi's Assassins', a recently launched book written by Anirudhya Mitra. Nagesh Kukunoor, known for directing films like 'Iqbal' and 'Dor', will helm the upcoming project.

94.title: Brendan Fraser supported me kicking off my H'wood career: Dwayne Johnson
94.article_body: Actor Dwayne Johnson took to Twitter and shared a video of Brendan Fraser receiving a standing ovation for his film 'The Whale'. Along with the video, Dwayne wrote he is "happy" to see Brendan receive a "beautiful ovation". "He supported me coming into his 'Mummy Returns' franchise for my first ever role, which kicked off my Hollywood career," Dwayne revealed.

95.title: Rahul Gandhi is 'Ichhadhari chunavi Hindu': MP Home Minister
95.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is an 'Ichhadhari chunavi Hindu' who visits temples when elections are near. He said that the people of Gujarat know well that Gandhi makes false poll promises. Gandhi had made the false promise of waiving farmers' loans up to ₹2 lakh in MP as well, Mishra added.

96.title: I don't even desire PM candidature: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
96.article_body: Reacting to the speculations about his PM candidature for the 2024 general elections, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "I'm not even...claimant, I don't even desire it." It's time for the Left parties, Congress and all regional parties to come together to form a united Opposition against the BJP, he said. Kumar's remarks came after he met CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury.

97.title: 'Stressed on cooperation against terrorism', says PM Modi at presser with Bangladesh PM
97.article_body: Addressing a press conference with Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said, "Today we also stressed on cooperation against terrorism and fundamentalism." He also said, "To keep the spirit of 1971 alive, it is very necessary that we face such forces together, who want to attack our mutual trust." Notably, India and Bangladesh signed seven MoUs today.

98.title: Do I look illiterate to you?: Maharashtra minister on being trolled for his remark
98.article_body: Maharashtra Public Health Minister Tanaji Sawant, who is being trolled for allegedly mistaking Haffkine Institute for Training, Research and Testing for a person named Haffkine, criticised the media. "[Media] isn't happy that this government is being formed...Do I look like an illiterate minister to you all?" Sawant asked. He asked for proof where he said that Haffkine is a person.

99.title: Elon Musk says 90% of comments on his tweets are bots, shares screenshot
99.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted a screenshot of some comments on one of his tweets, apparently by a fake account of Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao, and wrote, "90% of my comments are bots." Musk has accused Twitter of lying about the number of bots on the platform. He's currently seeking to terminate the $44 billion merger agreement signed with Twitter.

100.title: Remote-controlled cyborg cockroach fitted with solar cell created; video released
100.article_body: Japanese scientists have created a remote-controlled cyborg cockroach that can be used to inspect dangerous areas and monitor the environment. They developed a system using an ultrasoft solar cell that doesn't hinder the cockroach's movement. The system is wired into the cockroach's nervous system and pressing a button sends a shock, tricking it into moving in a certain direction.

101.title: It's childlike atmosphere on sets: Sudhanshu on rift reports with Rupali
101.article_body: Actor Sudhanshu Pandey opened up about reports stating he has a rift with 'Anupamaa' co-star Rupali Ganguly. "My reaction is, 'Why don't you come to the sets and watch?' Simple as that," he stated. "It's absolute fun all the time. We are...running around, poking fun at each other, cracking jokes. It's a very childlike atmosphere on the sets," he added.

102.title: Thank you for giving us many moments to say 'Raina hai na': Amit Mishra
102.article_body: Reacting to ex-India batter Suresh Raina announcing his retirement from all formats of cricket, Amit Mishra tweeted, "Every cricket and IPL fan will remember you for your timely knocks which you played for the country and CSK." Mishra added, "Wish you a great retirement life ahead. Thank you for giving us many moments to say, 'Raina hai na'."

103.title: This combination isn't working: Pujara on India's playing XI in Asia Cup
103.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara said that the current playing XI combination isn't working in the Asia Cup and Axar Patel should come in along with an extra seamer into the lineup. "Hardik has been bowling well, but we can't consider him a fifth bowler. I think expecting four overs from him every time is not correct," he added.

104.title: Mumbai Police arrest 7 for providing fake documents to criminals for bail
104.article_body: Mumbai Police have busted a racket where people were involved in producing fake documents to furnish bail for the undertrials in jail for serious offences. Seven people, including three women, in connection with the racket have been arrested. All female accused are homemakers, police said. Notably, the accused have submitted forged documents in Ulhasnagar, Kalyan, Nashik and Panvel courts.

105.title: KL Rahul, Athiya Shetty to marry at Suniel Shetty's Khandala bungalow: Report
105.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul and actress Athiya Shetty will marry at Suniel Shetty's bungalow Jahaan in Khandala, said reports. The date will be fixed keeping in mind the cricketer's work schedule and a wedding organiser has visited Khandala to do recce, reports added. Reacting to wedding rumours, Suniel earlier said, "The wedding will take place as soon as the kids decide."

106.title: I’m a booster rocket that fulfilled its function: Outgoing UK PM Johnson
106.article_body: In his last address as UK PM, Boris Johnson said he's "now like one of those booster rockets that has fulfilled its function". "I'll...be gently re-entering the atmosphere and splashing down invisibly in some remote and obscure corner of the Pacific," he added. Liz Truss was elected as UK's third woman PM on Monday after defeating Indian-origin Rishi Sunak.

107.title: My face isn't good enough to be on a film's poster: Darlings actor Vijay
107.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who featured in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Darlings', said his face is "not good enough" for a film's poster, during a recent event where he was being roasted. "But in scenes, this face becomes unforgettable. All these f****rs say...I'm not a star...That's strange because they cast me in...films to get that extra star in...reviews. I'm that star," he added.

108.title: No vacancy for PM post: RS Prasad after Nitish Kumar meets Rahul Gandhi
108.article_body: After Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Congress' Rahul Gandhi, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Had Nitish Kumar been proactive in developing Bihar like he is for his personal ambition, many Bihari youth would have got employment opportunity." "There's no vacancy for the PM post and many Opposition leaders are already standing in the queue. You too stand," Prasad added.

109.title: First-class passengers in Mumbai can upgrade passes to travel in AC locals: CR
109.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) announced that first-class local train passengers can travel in AC local trains by upgrading their quarterly passes. The pass holders need to pay the difference amount in fare while upgrading the ticket. The difference will be calculated for the period from when the upgrade was made till the date of expiry, the Railway officials said.

110.title: BSF foil smuggling bid, recover heroin worth ₹22.65 cr in Punjab
110.article_body: After reportedly foiling a smuggling attempt by Pakistan-based smugglers, troops of the Border Security Force (BSF) have recovered heroin worth ₹22.65 crore from a village in Punjab's Abohar. The seizure was done after BSF troops conducted a search operation based on specific inputs. In August, the BSF had recovered a cache of assault weapons along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab.

111.title: Man held with 116 grams gold in specially made undergarments at Hyd airport
111.article_body: Customs officials have arrested a passenger who was smuggling gold at the Hyderabad Airport and have seized 116 grams of gold valued at ₹6 lakh. The passenger was trying to smuggle gold in specially made undergarments. The customs officials did a body scan after being suspicious. A case has been registered against the passenger, reports said.

112.title: Ambulance leaves pregnant woman on UP road for failing to pay ₹1,000
112.article_body: An ambulance left a pregnant woman on the road in UP as the woman's family did not have enough money to pay them. In a video, the pregnant woman can be seen sitting on the road while her family tries to help her. The ambulance driver left her on the road as the family failed to pay ₹1,000, reports said.

113.title: Multiple cases of theft reported at Pune's Dagdusheth Ganpati pandal
113.article_body: Multiple cases of theft of cash and phones have been reported at Pune's Dagdusheth Ganpati pandal. Two FIRs, one by a woman reporting the theft of her mobile phone worth ₹44,000 and the other by a man reporting theft of ₹2,000 from his pocket, were filed on Sunday. Another complainant stated his mobile worth ₹19,491 was stolen on August 31.

114.title: Economist Bibek Debroy appointed Chancellor of Pune's Deccan College
114.article_body: Economist Bibek Debroy has been appointed as the Chancellor of Deccan College Post Graduate and Research Institute, Pune. He will succeed archaeologist AP Jamkhedkar. Debroy is presently the Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister. He has authored several books and also translated Sanskrit works on Indian mythological books.

115.title: Groom flees wedding reception after his first wife brings police to venue in Hyd
115.article_body: A man fled the reception party of his wedding with his second wife after his first wife reached the venue with police officers in Hyderabad. Syed Nazeer reportedly didn't inform his first wife Dr Sana Samreen about his second marriage. He allegedly sought money from her and started keeping away from her when her family couldn't pay the sum.

116.title: World no. 1 Swiatek enters her maiden quarter-final at US Open
116.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek advanced to her first US Open quarter-final after a 2-6, 6-4, 6-0 win over unseeded Jule Niemeier in fourth round. This is Swiatek's third Grand Slam quarter-final of 2022. The top seed won the match in two hours 23 minutes. Eighth seed Jessie Pegula beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-3, 6-2 in fourth round.

117.title: Oppn parties have to save country, Constitution together: CPI(M) leader
117.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday said that Opposition parties have to save the country and the Constitution together. His statement came after meeting Bihar CM Nitish Kumar in Delhi. CM Kumar said, "We have discussed that if the Left parties, regional parties in different states and Congress come together then it will be a big deal."

118.title: 313 applications get double COVID compensation in Pune: Officials
118.article_body: A total of 313 COVID-19 compensation applications have received double compensation from the Pune district, officials said. District Disaster Management officer Vitthal Banote said, "These double compensations have been due to banks depositing double amounts." Maharashtra government has declared an ex-gratia of ₹50,000 for the kin of those who lost their lives due to COVID-19 in the state.

119.title: Traffic restrictions in parts of Delhi for Central Vista inauguration on Sept 8
119.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police announced large-scale traffic diversions and restrictions on the roads leading to the C-Hexagon in India Gate and adjoining areas on Thursday (September 8) as PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to inaugurate Central Vista Avenue. Several roads will be closed for general traffic from 6 pm to 9 pm on Thursday for VVIPs' security, the police said.

120.title: Class 11 TN girl who threw baby gave birth in school toilet, cut umbilical cord with pen
120.article_body: The 16-year-old Class 11 girl, who allegedly threw her newborn baby in bushes in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district, gave birth alone in her school's toilet, police said. "The girl allegedly cut the umbilical cord herself using a pen and came back to the classroom," an official said. The baby's body was found by another student.

121.title: Ability only for changing names of roads: RJD MP over renaming Rajpath
121.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha reacted to Centre's announcement that Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area in New Delhi will be renamed 'Kartavya Path'. "What to say when there's silence on people-oriented concerns...ability is only to change roads' names?" Jha tweeted. "Today's biggest challenges like unemployment...if it has positive effect then everything is acceptable," Jha added.

122.title: India, Bangladesh sign 7 MoUs in presence of PM Modi, Sheikh Hasina
122.article_body: India and Bangladesh on Tuesday signed seven MoUs in presence of PM Narendra Modi and Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina. MoUs were signed in many sectors including water sharing, flood mitigation, defence and others. "Today, we've signed an important agreement regarding water-sharing of Kushiyara River," PM Modi said. "We've decided to extend cooperation in IT, space and nuclear sectors," he added.

123.title: This isn't a new thing for me: Amitabh Bachchan on having 5 releases in 2022
123.article_body: On being asked about having five releases in 2022, actor Amitabh Bachchan said that this is not a new thing for him. "We had multiple releases in a month back in the day. I have had 7-8 films released in a year," he added. He starred in 'Jhund' and 'Runway 34' and will be seen in 'Brahmāstra', 'Goodbye' and 'Uunchai'.

124.title: Shopee rescinded dozens of job offers in last 2 weeks: Report
124.article_body: E-commerce firm Shopee has rescinded dozens of job offers in the past two weeks after its parent firm Sea reported rising losses and slower revenue growth, Reuters reported. Shopee withdrew the offers days before the people were due to begin work. "Due to adjustments to hiring plans...a number of roles at Shopee are no longer available," a Shopee representative said.

125.title: PM Modi to visit Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on his birthday
125.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit the Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on his birthday on September 17. "On...same day, Cheetahs from South Africa will be brought to the park," said Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. Notably, the BJP will celebrate PM Modi's birthday from September 17 for a period of 16 days as "Seva Pakhwara" (service fortnight).

126.title: Met Muhammad Ali for a film, ended up getting a punch: Big B
126.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled his meeting with American boxer Muhammad Ali at the latter's Beverly Hills residence in Los Angeles. The actor said, "Producer-director Prakash Mehra ji wanted to make a film with Muhammad Ali and me...That film never got made but I ended up getting a punch." He further called the boxer "a wonderful human being".

127.title: Neither ruled myself in nor out: Tharoor on Cong President post
127.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that he has neither ruled himself in nor out of the election to the President's post to the party. "I hope many will contest in order to give the membership a wide choice," he said. The leadership vacuum at the top has had a damaging effect within the party, he added.

128.title: Senior citizen on morning walk robbed, attacked with sharp weapon in Pune
128.article_body: A senior citizen was reportedly robbed of his phone and attacked with a sharp weapon by three men in Pune's Kharadi on Thursday. According to police, Babam Dahifale, 60, was on a morning walk when three persons on a motorcycle tried to snatch his cell phone. As Dahifale resisted, one of the accused attacked him, injuring his leg and abdomen.

129.title: Actors possibly work the least while making a film: Rakul Preet Singh
129.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that actors "possibly work the least" while making a film. Rakul further stated that assistant directors to light-men work for "14-15 hours" a day during filmmaking. She added, "It's just for them that you want to go and watch the film in a theatre." The actress recently featured in 'Cuttputlli' and 'Runway 34'.

130.title: Lucknow hotel had iron grills on windows, no one could escape during fire: FIR
130.article_body: Lucknow's Hotel Levana, where a fire had broken out on Monday, had iron grills on windows, FIR registered in the case said. The FIR reportedly added that due to the iron grills, no one could come out from the window during the fire incident and that the fire brigade had difficulty breaking windows.

131.title: 'Thiruchitrambalam' earns ₹100cr, becomes Dhanush's highest earner
131.article_body: Dhanush-starrer Tamil film 'Thiruchitrambalam' has collected over ₹100 crore at the worldwide box office, becoming the highest earning film of the actor's career. The film, which also stars Nithya Menen, Raashii Khanna, Prakash Raj, Bharathiraja and Priya Bhavani Shankar, features Dhanush in the role of a food delivery boy. The actor was last seen in Hollywood film 'The Gray Man'.

132.title: Minority is not allowed errors: Varun Grover, Pooja Bhatt support Arshdeep
132.article_body: Celebrities Varun Grover, Pooja Bhatt and Angad Bedi supported cricketer Arshdeep Singh after he was trolled over his dropped catch in India-Pakistan Asia Cup match. Varun tweeted in Hindi, "Minority is not allowed to make human errors. They should always remain perfect. Majority will take care of imperfections." Pooja wrote, "Society cannot cannibalise success and conveniently discard failures."

133.title: J'khand Congress chief calls BJP 'bachcha chor' after trust vote
133.article_body: A day after Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren won the trust vote, state Congress chief Rajesh Thakur on Tuesday called the BJP 'bachcha chor' or thieves of children. "Our MLAs were not going anywhere. BJP destabilises the country's non-BJP state governments and we always take precautions because they are like 'bachcha chor'," said Thakur.

134.title: Hyd to get 23-km long solar roof cycle track by 2023, KTR shares video
134.article_body: Hyderabad will have a 23-km long cycle track with a solar roof by 2023, Telangana Minister of Municipal Administration and Urban Development, KT Rama Rao, announced on Twitter. While sharing a video, he said that he will be laying the foundation of the project on Tuesday. "Plan to deliver it before summer 2023," he wrote.

135.title: It will always remain special to me: Omung Kumar on 8 years of 'Mary Kom'
135.article_body: Filmmaker Omung Kumar on Monday took to Instagram to share a series of still and behind-the-scenes pictures to mark eight years since the release of 'Mary Kom'. He wrote alongside the pictures, "My first directorial film 'MARY KOM'. Thank you to everyone who made this possible." The Priyanka Chopra-starrer is a biographical sports film based on boxer Mary Kom.

136.title: I think India might bring in another finisher vs Sri Lanka: Sehwag
136.article_body: Ahead of India's Asia Cup Super 4 stage match against Sri Lanka today, Virender Sehwag said India might include wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in the playing XI. "If you have brought in Karthik at the age of 37...then he should play till the World Cup," stated Sehwag. Karthik played in India's first two games in the Asia Cup.

137.title: Shah to visit Hyderabad on Sept 17 to celebrate Liberation Day
137.article_body: To celebrate Hyderabad Liberation Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah will attend an inaugural programme as a chief guest on September 17 in the city. "The celebrations will be organised throughout the year under the auspices of the Central Department of Culture to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the state," said Union Minister G Kishan Reddy.

138.title: Need to upgrade infrastructure: T'gana minister KTR amid B'luru flooding
138.article_body: After heavy rains lashed Bengaluru, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao made a slew of observations regarding the flooding situation in the city. "With rapid urbanisation and sub-urbanisation, infrastructure is bound to crumble as we haven't infused enough capital into upgrading the same," he tweeted. KTR said that India needs bold reforms in urban planning and governance.

139.title: Husband allegedly murders wife over dowry in Ghaziabad; arrested
139.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly murdering his wife at his house in Ghaziabad. The wife's uncle claimed that the accused beat her with a baseball bat and later strangled her with a piece of cloth on Sunday night. "The woman’s family has alleged that their daughter was killed for dowry," an assistant superintendent of police said.

140.title: ₹1,500 crore released for draining of water in Bengaluru: Karnataka CM
140.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that his government has given ₹1,500 crore for draining of water in Bengaluru as the city is facing waterlogging problems due to heavy rainfall. He further said that ₹300 crore has been given to remove encroachments. "We have taken it as a challenge. Our officers, engineers and SDRF team are working 24/7," he added.

141.title: BJP MLAs to meet President to demand dismissal of Delhi government
141.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs will meet President Droupadi Murmu in the national capital today to demand dismissal of AAP government over corruption allegations against party leaders. The legislators will also submit a memorandum to the President. Leader of Opposition in Delhi Assembly Ramvir Singh Bidhuri claimed that the AAP had used abusive language against Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena.

142.title: Truck hits BJP MLA Nitesh Rane's car on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
142.article_body: A truck hit a car in which Maharashtra BJP MLA Nitesh Rane and his family members were travelling on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, police said. No one was injured in the accident which took place at Urse toll plaza on the expressway, police added. "We have booked the truck driver under relevant sections of the IPC," an official said.

143.title: Dog bites child in Ghaziabad society's lift as its owner looks on, video surfaces
143.article_body: A CCTV footage of an incident where a woman's pet dog bites a child in the elevator of a housing society in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad as the woman looks on and does nothing has surfaced online. In the video, the child is seen rubbing the injured area in pain. The child's parents registered a police complaint regarding the incident.

144.title: Will be supporting Truss every step of the way: Outgoing UK PM Johnson
144.article_body: In his last address as UK PM, Boris Johnson said that he's "now like one of those booster rockets that has fulfilled its function". Johnson vowed to support PM-elect Liz Truss "every step of the way". He and Truss will now travel to Scotland, where he'll offer his resignation to Queen Elizabeth II, after which she'll appoint Truss as PM.

145.title: 17-yr-old boy hit by train while recording Instagram Reel in Telangana; video goes viral
145.article_body: A video showing a 17-year-old boy getting hit by a train in Telangana while recording an Instagram Reel has gone viral on social media. The boy was severely injured in the incident. The boy could be seen getting hit by the train from behind as he was walking very close to the track near Kazipet Railway Station in Hanumakonda district.

146.title: Pak food app shares meme after Team India's defeat, Zomato says 'Use your own template'
146.article_body: After Pakistan defeated India on Sunday, Careem Pakistan, a food delivery app, shared a meme from the movie 'Hera Pheri' while tagging food delivery app Zomato and tweeted in Hindi, "We were just calling to place an order." Meanwhile, Zomato replied to their meme and wrote, "Meme template tou apne use karo (At least use your own meme template)."

147.title: There is no bravado in speeding: Hansal Mehta after Cyrus Mistry's death
147.article_body: After the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, filmmaker Hansal Mehta wrote on Twitter, "There is NO bravado in speeding." He shared about his near-fatal accident in Fiji 30 years ago when his car dropped from a height. "I was speeding. I was wearing a seat belt. I escaped an accident that would have surely ended my life."

148.title: Impact of Afridi's sixes in 2014 Asia Cup match: Hafeez on Ashwin not playing
148.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez termed Shahid Afridi's two consecutive sixes in the last over of an India-Pakistan match in Asia Cup 2014, bowled by Ravichandran Ashwin, as the reason why Ashwin hasn't featured recently against Pakistan. Afridi's sixes helped Pakistan chase down a 246-run target. Ashwin didn't feature in both games played so far against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022.

149.title: Actress Archana seen crying, shouting at Tirupati staff; claims they demanded bribe
149.article_body: Actress Archana Gautam, who is also a Congress leader, alleged on Monday, September 5, that Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams officials had asked her for a bribe to allow her darshan. She was seen crying and shouting at staff in a video that she posted on Twitter. "In the name of VIP darshan, ₹10,500 is taken," she alleged.

150.title: Volkswagen to list Porsche in one of the biggest IPOs in years
150.article_body: Volkswagen will be listing Porsche in one of the biggest initial public offerings in years. It intends to list Porsche in Frankfurt and offer 25% of Porsche's preferred stock to private investors in a public offering aimed for late September or early October. Porsche SE has agreed to purchase the shares at the IPO price plus a 7.5% premium.

151.title: Unacademy CEO's family, pet evacuated on a tractor in B'luru, says 'things are bad'
151.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal shared a video of his family and pet dog being evacuated on a tractor in Bengaluru after heavy rainfall in the city led to waterlogging in many areas. "Our society [is] now submerged. Things are bad. Please take care," Munjal tweeted. Earlier, upGrad CEO Arjun Mohan said he went to office on a tractor on Monday.

152.title: Taiwan’s military more powerful now due to Chinese drills: Prez Tsai
152.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Tuesday said that recent Chinese military drills around the island have helped improve Taiwan's combat abilities. "Our national military's combat skills are more mature and its combat power is more powerful," she added. China conducted several drills around Taiwan in response to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taipei last month.

153.title: Trending on Twitter isn't cool, don't want to be social media star: Shehnaaz
153.article_body: During an interview, actress Shehnaaz Gill said trending on Twitter isn't cool. "It's one thing to be famous...be a social media star and another thing to be an artist. I want to be an artist," she stated. Shehnaaz added she doesn't want to be a social media influencer. "I want to be someone who can inspire people," Shehnaaz said.

154.title: Action recommended against 22 engineers, officers after Lucknow hotel fire
154.article_body: The Lucknow Development Authority (LDA) has submitted its initial probe report on the fire that broke out in Hotel Levana in Lucknow on Monday. The report has recommended action against 22 engineers and zonal officers for allegedly conniving with the builder and ignoring illegal construction activity. Reports earlier said that the hotel will be sealed and demolished.

155.title: British man arrested in Goa for possessing drugs worth ₹15 lakh
155.article_body: A 76-year-old British man has been arrested for allegedly possessing illegal drugs worth ₹15.48 lakh in Goa, an official said on Tuesday. The police seized 12.2 grams of ganja, 40 ecstasy tablets, 80 grams of MDMA and several capsules of LSD during a raid on a property rented by him in Arambol beach village.

156.title: Tom Cruise stands atop flying plane without harness; Twitter users react on video
156.article_body: A video showing Hollywood actor Tom Cruise standing atop an airborne plane without any harness for the upcoming Mission Impossible: Dead Reckoning Part 1 is going viral online. Reacting to the video, a Twitter user said, "Tom cruise is absolutely INSANE, love that for him." "I literally screamed when the planes dropped," said another.

157.title: Delhi winter pollution plan by Sept 15: Environment Minister Gopal Rai
157.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said that all agencies and government departments have been asked to submit suggestions by September 7 on how to tackle the winter air pollution. A detailed action plan will be shared by September 15, Rai added. The first report on the functioning of the Connaught Place smog tower will also be released on September 15.

158.title: Noida Metro Rail corridor to soon connect Sector 142 with Botanical Garden
158.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has submitted a detailed project report to Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) on building a corridor which will link the Botanical Garden station on Blue and Magenta Line with Sector 142 station on Aqua Metro Line. As per reports, construction has already begun on the corridor.

159.title: Delhi Police arrests man who raped, cheated constable of ₹28 lakh
159.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has arrested a 28-year-old man who allegedly posed as a Major in the Indian Army and raped and cheated a female constable of ₹28 lakh. The accused reportedly attacked and locked police officers in a room with the help of others when they went to arrest him in Bihar. Later, police arrested the accused in Jharkhand.

160.title: Musk criticises Amazon's 'Rings of Power', says 'Tolkien turning in his grave'
160.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has criticised Amazon's 'The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power' based on a novel by JRR Tolkien. "Tolkien is turning in his grave...Almost every male character so far is a coward, a jerk or both. Only Galadriel is brave, smart and nice," Musk tweeted. Amazon has reportedly spent $1 billion on this series.

161.title: Amazon planning to enter Japanese prescription drug market: Report
161.article_body: Amazon.com is mulling entering the prescription drug sales market in Japan by partnering with small and mid-sized pharmacies, the Nikkei newspaper reported. Electronic prescriptions would be allowed for the first time in Japan starting next year and that is when the company is planning the foray. The Japanese government sets the prices for prescription drugs in the country.

162.title: Bengal bags int'l tourism award for 'Best Destination for Culture'
162.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced that the state has won the International Travel Award 2023 for 'Best Destination for Culture'. The award will be conferred by Pacific Area Travel Writers Association, an affiliate of the UN World Tourism Organization on March 9 next year in Berlin. Banerjee will attend the ceremony.

163.title: Tiafoe was better than me, that's why I'm having plane back home: Nadal
163.article_body: After being knocked out of the US Open, Rafael Nadal said he doesn't want to make any excuses for his defeat against Frances Tiafoe. "We need to be enough critic with [ourselves]...At the end, the only thing that happened is...I faced a player [who] was better than me. And that's why I'm having a plane back home," he stated.

164.title: 4 of 7 food samples from Delhi AIIMS hostel messes fail safety test
164.article_body: Officials from Delhi food safety department, who inspected the hostel messes at Delhi AIIMS, said food samples collected from the institute have failed the food safety test. "At least four samples out of seven...have failed the test," officer Ranjit Singh said, adding, notices will be issued to mess contractors. Report of eight more samples is yet to arrive, Singh added.

165.title: Oil prices surge 4% as OPEC+ agrees to marginal cut in production
165.article_body: Oil prices surged by 4% on Monday amid the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and its allies agreeing to a marginal production cut by 1,00,000 barrels per day for October to boost prices. Brent crude futures for November delivery rose by 3.8% to $96.55 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate crude increased by 3.6% to $89.98.

166.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal's death ruled a suicide
166.article_body: The death of Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal, who jumped from his 18th-floor apartment in NYC's 'Jenga Building', has been ruled a suicide, NYC Medical Examiner's Office said. Arnal died from "multiple" blunt force trauma. He left no note behind and did not say anything to his wife, who was home at the time, WNBC reported citing sources.

167.title: Charmme Kaur takes break from social media after 'Liger' failure
167.article_body: Actress-producer Charmme Kaur announced that she is taking a break from social media, writing in a statement, "Chill guys! Just taking a break...@PuriConnects will bounce back Bigger and Better...Until then, Live and let Live." This comes after 'Liger', which was produced by Charmme along with Karan Johar, Puri Jagannadh, Apoorva Mehta and Hiroo Yash Johar, failed at the box office.

168.title: S Korea faces losing half its population every generation: Musk
168.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said, "South Korea is currently tracking to lose about half its population roughly every generation." His comments followed a tweet which said South Korea plans to give every family with a newborn child a monthly allowance of $740. "Long lifespan hides the dire nature of the problem," Musk added discussing South Korea's population issue.

169.title: Liquor-addicted Hyderabad man stabs wife to death in front of her family
169.article_body: A man stabbed his wife to death in front of her family members in Hyderabad. Reports said the couple used to fight frequently and the woman had shifted to her mother's place recently. On Monday, the man went to his wife under the pretext of discussing family matters. He stabbed her, following which, she died due to loss of blood.

170.title: Malaysian contractor linked to US Navy bribery scandal escapes house arrest
170.article_body: A Malaysian businessman at the heart of a massive bribery scandal involving the US Navy has escaped house arrest, authorities said. Leonard Francis, known as "Fat Leonard", had pleaded guilty in 2015 to bribing US Navy officers in exchange for lucrative military contracts. Francis had cut off his GPS bracelet and fled from his home on Sunday morning, officials said.

171.title: Man suffers cardiac arrest before doctor in Maha, he saves his life; video goes viral
171.article_body: A video of a doctor saving a man's life who suffered a cardiac arrest in Maharashtra's Kolhapur has gone viral. The man is seen feeling uncomfortable and tapping on a table following which the doctor rushes to thump on his chest. Rajya Sabha MP Dhananjay Mahadik, who shared the video on Twitter, identified the doctor as Kolhapur cardiologist Arjun Adnaik.

172.title: 60-year-old man attacked after he resists mobile theft bid in Pune
172.article_body: A 60-year-old man was severely injured after three men allegedly attacked him with a sickle when he resisted a mobile theft bid in Pune's Kharadi, police said. The trio managed to escape with the mobile, police added. The man was taking a morning walk while listening to the news when the incident occurred. No arrests have been made yet.

173.title: What message does he want: Sunil Gavaskar on Virat Kohli's 'Only MS Dhoni messaged' remark
173.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's statement that out of his former India teammates, only MS Dhoni messaged him after he quit Test captaincy, Sunil Gavaskar said, "What message did he want?" He added, "Encouragement? But then he's done with captaincy...so why would he need encouragement?" Gavaskar further said Kohli should name the players who didn't message him.

174.title: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's last rites held in Mumbai
174.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away after his car met with an accident on Sunday, was cremated at the Worli crematorium in Mumbai. The 54-year-old executive was en route from Ahmedabad to Mumbai when the car he was travelling in hit a divider in Maharashtra's Palghar district.
