Mistry is survived by his wife Rohiqa and two children.

175.title: 'Black' actress Ayesha Kapur to make lead debut in 'Hari-Om'
175.article_body: Actress Ayesha Kapur, who portrayed the younger version of Rani Mukerji in 2005 film 'Black', will be making her leading debut in 'Hari-Om' opposite Anshuman Jha. Ayesha has reportedly been working on her Hindi diction for nearly six months with language coach Kulvinder Bakshish. The film, which also features Raghuvir Yadav and Soni Razdan, will go on floors in September.

176.title: Filmmaker playing blame games: Rakesh on discussion on reducing actors' fees
176.article_body: While talking about discussion on fees that actors and actresses charge for their films and opinions saying they should reduce it, actor and filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said that filmmakers are playing blame games. "Big actors add to the film in many ways. That's why filmmakers cast them. But the actors get blamed when the film doesn't do well," he added.

177.title: Cool to see new era, I don't think it'll be 'Big 3' now: Tiafoe after win over Nadal
177.article_body: After defeating Rafael Nadal in the fourth round of the ongoing US Open, world number 26 Frances Tiafoe said it's "cool to see a new era" in tennis. "I don't think it will be a 'Big Three'. It'll be like a big 12. There's a bunch of guys playing great tennis," he added. Tiafoe defeated Nadal 6-4, 4-6, 6-4, 6-3.

178.title: Come and post from your real accounts if you've courage: Shami to people abusing Arshdeep
178.article_body: Cricketer Mohammad Shami has defended Arshdeep Singh after the latter got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022. "Come and post from your real accounts if you have courage. Anyone can post from fake accounts," Shami said, referring to the trolls. "I'll only say to Arshdeep, don’t let this hamper you," he added.

179.title: SRK to shoot for Salman Khan's 'Tiger 3' in September: Report
179.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly be shooting for a "special sequence" in Salman Khan-starrer 'Tiger 3' by the end of September. Currently, Shah Rukh is shooting for Atlee's 'Jawan' and Salman is shooting for 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. As per earlier reports, Salman will also have a cameo in Shah Rukh's 'Pathaan'.

180.title: Irresponsible statement: Union Minister on J'khand CM's 'incidents happen' remark
180.article_body: Reacting to Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren’s "incidents happen" remark over a tribal girl’s rape and murder in Dumka, Union Minister Arjun Munda called the statement "irresponsible". "Instead of saying the police in the area will hold accountability and action will be taken against the culprit, Hemant Soren made an irresponsible statement. This is very shameful," Munda said.

181.title: Army truck hits bike from behind in Haryana; 17-year-old boy dead
181.article_body: A 17-year-old boy died and his friend was injured after an Army truck allegedly hit his bike in Haryana's Ambala on Monday. The deceased's father, who was riding on another bike behind the duo, claimed that the truck overtook the two-wheeler and hit them from behind. "The driver fled the spot and left the truck behind," the deceased's father added.

182.title: Manoj Bajpayee called after watching me in Delhi Crime 2: Jatin Goswami
182.article_body: 'Delhi Crime 2' actor Jatin Goswami revealed Manoj Bajpayee called him after watching his performance in the show. "To get a call from him is a big deal. He liked my work," Jatin further added. Talking about his 'Delhi Crime 2' co-star Shefali Shah, Jatin said, "I didn't have any scenes with her...I've been a huge fan of her work."

183.title: Policeman injured at Pune hospital as criminal undergoing treatment attacked
183.article_body: A policeman deployed at Pune's Sassoon Hospital got injured after a criminal undergoing treatment was attacked by unidentified suspects with sharp weapons, police said. The criminal is linked to the outfit Hindu Rashtra Sena, police added. "A police guard deployed at the ward sustained injuries on the hand trying to stop the attackers," police stated.

184.title: UP school principal kills self after being tortured by loan sharks
184.article_body: A 45-year-old principal of a primary school allegedly died by suicide in his office after being tortured by loan sharks in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj, police said. The police added that in a suicide note, which was found lying beside him, the deceased held three people responsible for his death. A probe has been initiated, the district's SP said.

185.title: Mahindra praises people seen travelling on excavator in flooded B'luru; criticised
185.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Tuesday shared a video while praising people who were seen travelling on an excavator in flooded Bengaluru. Mahindra wrote, "Where there is a will, there's a way." Reacting to his post, a Twitter user wrote, "Hardly anything to celebrate" and another commented, "[Your] first thought should be why the civic authority has failed".

186.title: Pregnant woman carried on bamboo stretcher for 5 km in Meghalaya
186.article_body: A pregnant woman was carried on a makeshift bamboo stretcher for five kilometres to a hospital in Meghalaya's Ri Bhoi district, where she delivered a baby, said an official. The woman, suffering from high blood pressure, struggled with labour pain through the journey. "Volunteers from Jailum village took turns to carry the patient," said a hospital official.

187.title: Delhi civic body collects over ₹23 lakh as fines over mosquito breeding
187.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) issued 77,538 legal notices and filed 26,320 prosecutions or challans over mosquito breeding in the national capital. It imposed charges on 10,438 house building owners and collected ₹23,28,700 as administrative charges, the civic body said in a statement. MCD's jurisdiction reported 92 dengue cases out of 244 cases reported across Delhi by September 3, 2022.

188.title: Flights to be delayed at Bengaluru airport after heavy rainfall
188.article_body: Flights are likely to be slightly delayed today after heavy rain and due to weather conditions, Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport announced. Massive traffic jams were reported in the city as several areas remained severely waterlogged. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that this was the highest rainfall in Bengaluru in last 32 years, adding that 164 lakes have been filled.

189.title: New York would've been like B'luru if it received such rainfall: K'taka min
189.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Health and Family Welfare K Sudhakar said the situation in New York would have been the same as Bengaluru if it received the same amount of heavy rainfall. "Whose fault is it that hundreds of villages have been merged into Greater Bengaluru without being developed?" Sudhakar said. He added that complaining is easier than solving a problem.

190.title: 6 booked for robbing family of over ₹2 lakh in Greater Noida
190.article_body: Police have booked at least six unidentified people for reportedly breaking into a home in Greater Noida, taking a family hostage and fleeing with items worth more than ₹2 lakh. The incident took place around 2:30 am on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. "Police will arrest the suspects at the earliest,” said Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

191.title: Delhi policewoman seen slapping father-in-law in front of mother in viral video; booked
191.article_body: A case has been registered against a sub-inspector in Delhi after a video showing her slapping her father-in-law multiple times in front of her mother and colleague went viral. The video shows the man pushing the policewoman's mother when she slapped him at his house. Delhi Police said information has been shared with concerned authority to take suitable departmental action.

192.title: ED raids 30 locations in several states in connection with Delhi Excise Policy case
192.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted raids at over 30 locations in Delhi and multiple cities in Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Telangana and Maharashtra in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy case. ED in Delhi searched businessman Sameer Mahandru's Jor Bagh residence and in Gurugram, it raided the premises of Amit Arora, director of Buddy Retail Pvt Limited.

193.title: Nitish Kumar meets Rahul Gandhi in Delhi, discusses 2024 polls
193.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Congress MP Rahul Gandhi in Delhi and discussed the strategy to unite the Opposition for 2024 Lok Sabha polls. According to reports, Kumar expressed gratitude to the Congress leader for his support. "If the Opposition will get united, then a good atmosphere will be created. I have no desire...(to become the PM)," said Kumar.

194.title: NGT directs NHAI to plant 80,000 saplings near Gurugram-Rewari highway
194.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to locate a land within 10 km of the Gurugram-Rewari national highway project for planting 80,000 saplings as a compensatory afforestation. The NGT said that it will be the responsibility of the project’s promoter to find a suitable land for planting the trees.

195.title: Suresh Raina retires from Indian Premier League
195.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina has retired from Indian Premier League (IPL). The former CSK batter told Dainik Jagran that he has taken No Objection Certificate (NOC) from Uttar Pradesh Cricket Association (UPCA) and has informed BCCI about the same. "I am now free to feature in foreign T20 leagues," the 35-year-old said.

196.title: Every cricketer wants to win game for his country, no one plays to lose: Arshdeep's father
196.article_body: Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh's father Darshan Singh has said, "Every cricketer wants to win the game for his country. No one plays to lose." After India lost against Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super 4 game, the 23-year-old pacer was abused on social media for dropping Asif Ali's catch. "Arshdeep will only get mentally stronger after this," his father added.

197.title: Nadal knocked out by world no. 26 Frances Tiafoe in US Open 4th round
197.article_body: Rafael Nadal was knocked out of the US Open following a 4-6, 6-4, 4-6, 3-6 defeat in the US Open's fourth round against American tennis player and world number 26 Frances Tiafoe. Nadal suffered a defeat in a Grand Slam for the first time in 2022, having entered the match with a 22-0 record in Grand Slams this year.

198.title: Karthik did not face a ball, still lost his place in the lineup: Inzamam
198.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he observed a sense of "panic" in the selection of Team India's lineup for the recent match against Pakistan, which they lost. "India...were under pressure...Dinesh Karthik did not face a ball and still lost his place in the playing XI," added Inzamam. Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht said India may have "lost their sleep" following the loss.

199.title: Ashwin should play: Karim on India's playing XI against Sri Lanka
199.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said spinner Ravichandran Ashwin should be included in India's playing XI against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match today. "Unfortunately, Deepak Hooda will have to miss out. [But] they must go back to playing with a combination of five bowlers and Hardik Pandya as the sixth bowling option," added Karim.

200.title: MP writes letter to Scindia over rise in air fares during Onam
200.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP V Sivadasan wrote a letter to Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia over the rise in air fares during Onam festival. “Ahead of Onam, air carriers are jacking up the fares on select routes based on demand. This has affected both domestic and international travellers. Ticket prices from Thiruvananthapuram to other cities have skyrocketed,” Sivadasan said.

201.title: I am laughing at all these tweets: Arshdeep to parents after being abused for catch drop
201.article_body: After he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan, Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh told his parents, "I'm laughing at all these tweets and messages." "I am only going to take positives from it. This incident has only given me more confidence," he further said. Earlier, his father said, "Fans get emotional and say a few words."

202.title: Severe head trauma, injuries to vital organs led to Mistry's death: Autopsy
202.article_body: Autopsies revealed that the deaths of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and his friend Jehangir Pandole were caused by "severe head trauma and multiple external and internal injuries to vital organs". Mistry sustained major head trauma along with multiple fractures in the chest, head region, thigh and neck, said a doctor at JJ hospital, where the autopsies were conducted.

203.title: Sanjana posts message after calling a troll 'chomu aadmi' over comment on pic with Bumrah
203.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah's wife, TV presenter Sanjana Ganesan, posted a message on Instagram after she called a troll "chomu aadmi" over his comment on her picture with the Team India bowler. "While I do think it's important to stand up to internet trolls and bullies, I don't agree with dragging someone's religion, nationality, ethnicity or identity into the matter," she wrote.

204.title: I don't want to be in politics anymore: TMC leader Tapas Roy
204.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLA Tapas Roy said he wants to quit politics and would let his party know about his decision at an appropriate time. "There comes a time when one needs to hang up their boots...I too have to call it a day," he added. Roy is a five-time MLA who had served as councillor of Kolkata Municipal Corporation.

205.title: Drunk Indian-origin ambulance driver jailed for causing accident in S'pore
205.article_body: A 27-year-old Indian-origin man was sentenced to two years in prison in Singapore for driving an ambulance under the influence of alcohol and causing an accident in which one person was injured. G Mohanavarooman Oyyappan reportedly had 183 mg of ethanol in every 100 ml of his blood, over double the prescribed drink-driving limit of 80 mg per 100 ml.

206.title: Adani meets Bangladesh PM, commits to power transmission line by Dec
206.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani met Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in New Delhi on Monday. Taking to Twitter, Adani called her vision for Bangladesh "inspirational and stunningly bold". He also said that Adani Power is committed to commissioning its 1,600 MW Godda Power Project in Jharkhand and dedicated transmission line to Bangladesh by Bijoy Dibosh, i.e. December 16, 2022.

207.title: Govt to sell Hindustan Zinc's residual stake in tranches: Report
207.article_body: The government is not likely to sell its residual 29.54% stake in the Vedanta-controlled Hindustan Zinc (HZL) all at once, instead in tranches, an official source said. The Centre's stake is valued at around ₹36,000 crore, based on the current market price of the company's shares. Meanwhile, bankers will soon begin road shows for the offer for sale (OFS).

208.title: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Arvind Giri passes away due to heart attack
208.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Bharatiya Janata Party MLA Arvind Giri passed away due to a heart attack on Tuesday. Reports said Giri was being taken to Lucknow for treatment when he passed away near Sitapur. State Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath condoled his demise. "May Lord Shri Ram grant departed soul a place at his feet...and strength to...the bereaved family member," he said.

209.title: Boycott B'wood is regressive, everything we earn goes into economy: Abhishek
209.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bajaj in an interview called the trend of boycott Bollywood "very regressive", adding that it impacts the trickle-down effect on the economy. "The money the industry earns eventually goes into the economy. We are losing on that," he added. The actor further said that instead of cancel culture, the hashtag should be "support the talent".

210.title: Robbers chop off 75-year-old woman's leg to steal anklet in Rajasthan
210.article_body: At least two men entered the house of a 75-year-old woman and chopped off one of her legs to steal her silver anklet in Rajasthan's Bundi district. The victim was alone at home and sleeping when the robbers tried to suffocate her. She was declared to be in a critical state by local doctors and referred to a Kota hospital.

211.title: 'Brahmastra' gets U/A certificate; runtime to be 2 hours, 46 minutes
211.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra' with a U/A certificate. The film, which will be releasing on September 9, is set to have a runtime of 2 hours, 46 minutes, and 54 seconds. 'Brahmastra', directed by Ayan Mukerji, will also feature Amitabh Bachchan.

212.title: Rauf's last over vs India was match-winning: Pak bowling coach Tait
212.article_body: Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait has said Haris Rauf's last over during India's innings in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match was "match-winning". "Rauf has been working so hard on his yorkers and slower balls...And his execution in the last over was perfect," added Tait. Rauf bowled three dots to Virat Kohli and conceded 10 runs in the over.

213.title: F*ck your hostage video: Chris Rock on Will Smith's apology for slap
213.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock during his stand-up show in London commented on actor Will Smith's apology video for slapping him onstage at the 2022 Oscars. The comedian said in his set, "F*ck your hostage video...Yes, that sh*t hurt." Will had posted an apology video on social media in July, saying that Chris has not responded to his attempts to reach out.

214.title: Trump once tried to pay a lawyer he owed $2 mn with a horse, book claims
214.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump once tried to pay a lawyer he owed $2 million with a horse supposedly worth $5 million, a new book by New York Times journalist David Enrich claimed. Enrich in the book, 'Servants of the Damned', said the lawyer was initially too stunned by the offer to speak but eventually retorted, "This isn't the 1800s."

215.title: 200 km roads unswept in Gurugram after civic body fails to pay fuel bills
215.article_body: At least 200 kilometres of roads in Gurugram have not been swept since Friday morning after the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) failed to clear the fuel bills of 13 road-sweeping machines. The civic body owes a total of ₹16 lakh to various fuel pump owners and the amount has remained unpaid for the past 12 months, officials said.

216.title: 26 prisoners test HIV positive at UP's Barabanki district jail
216.article_body: As many as 26 prisoners have tested positive for HIV at the district jail in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki, officials said on Monday. Of those infected, two prisoners are undergoing anti-retroviral treatment at Dr Ram Manohar Lohia hospital in Lucknow, a jailor said. The district's Chief Medical Officer said that efforts are being made to test all the prisoners for HIV.

217.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of roads to avoid today due to waterlogging
217.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police issued advisory asking people to avoid certain roads due to severe waterlogging and suggested alternative roads for commuters. The police diverted traffic from road near Ecospace of Outer Ring Road (ORR) and also asked people to avoid Channasandra road and Sarjapur road. The HSR Traffic Police asked commuters to take alternative roads like Hosur road.

218.title: Met Arshdeep's family, we all stand firmly with him: AAP MP
218.article_body: AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Monday met Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh's family in Punjab after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan on Sunday. "We all stand firmly with Arsh," Chadha tweeted. "I...met bowling superstar Arshdeep's family in Kharar, Punjab. His struggle...from humble origins to playing for India on international stage is inspiring," he added.

219.title: 2 posing as police personnel rob Sudanese national in Gurugram, booked
219.article_body: Two unidentified suspects have been booked for allegedly robbing a Sudanese national in Gurugram's Sector-38. According to police, Mohammad Mustafa was targeted in front of a private hospital on Saturday. The accused, posing as police officers, took Mustafa's bag on the pretext of checking it and fled with ₹20,000 cash, some Dollars and Dirham, police added.

220.title: Pune to release aid of ₹5.88 crore for rain relief, rehabilitation
220.article_body: Following heavy rainfall between June 1 and August 31 in Pune, the district's disaster management department has announced an aid of ₹5.88 crore to farmers for relief and rehabilitation. The District Disaster Management Officer said that during the three-month period, four people died, 479 homes and huts were damaged and 297 villages were affected where crops were damaged.

221.title: 2 children aged 14 drown, 1 missing in Jharkhand waterfall
221.article_body: At least two children, both aged 14, drowned and one went missing in a waterfall in Jharkhand's Koderma on Monday, police said. The incident took place when the three friends went to Vrindaha waterfall in the Telaiya Police Station area. Notably, this comes after a 24-year-old woman and a 16-year-old girl drowned in the Damodar river on Sunday in Ramgarh.

222.title: 22-yr-old woman returning from work falls in waterlogged Bengaluru road, electrocuted
222.article_body: A 22-year-old woman named Akhila, who worked as a receptionist at a private firm in Bengaluru, died due to electrocution on Monday night. The incident occurred when she was returning home after work on her scooter and fell down on a waterlogged road. "She came in contact with an electric wire when she fell resulting in her death," police said.

223.title: Clash erupts after Dalit girl harassed in UP, dozens injured
223.article_body: A clash erupted between two groups after a Dalit girl was harassed by some young men while she was returning home from tuition in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Monday, said police. The two groups pelted stones at each other, leaving at least a dozen injured. Some of the injured suffered severe wounds, according to police.

224.title: Private hospitals run like businesses, can't ask govt for security: SC
224.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday stated private hospitals and nursing homes operate like business enterprises and charge exorbitantly, adding they can't expect the Centre and State to provide security for private players. The apex court was hearing a plea stating that doctors and healthcare workers are vulnerable to attacks and emphasised having a mechanism for their security.

225.title: 35 killed after a bus struck an explosive device in Burkina Faso
225.article_body: A bus struck an improvised explosive device in Burkina Faso, killing 35 civilians and leaving 37 injured. The escorted supply convoy was heading to Ouagadougou with traders and students onboard, residents reportedly said. The convoy hit the explosive device between the towns of Djibo and Bourzanga, an area where militants escalated attacks on villages, police and military outposts since 2015.

226.title: Putin buying artillery shells, rockets from North Korea amid war in Ukraine
226.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, Russian President Vladimir Putin is purchasing an increasing amount of arms and ammunition from ally North Korea as it feels the impact of western sanctions, according to US intelligence. Russia is buying artillery shells and rockets, according to a New York Times report. However, the US intelligence did not reveal the numbers purchased by Russia.

227.title: Always against politics messing up with sports: Digvijaya on Arshdeep
227.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Tuesday said he has always been against politics and politicians "messing up" with sports. His statement came after Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan during India's five-wicket defeat. "This can happen with the best of cricketers…Subject him to such malafide campaign is outrageous," Digvijaya tweeted.

228.title: Japan to spend over $12 million on ex-PM Abe's state funeral
228.article_body: Japan will spend over $12 million on the state funeral for the former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, according to the government's new estimates. The ceremony, which will be held on September 27 at Tokyo's Nippon Budokan hall, will be attended by over 6,000 guests including 190 foreign delegations. According to Chief Cabinet Secretary, the security fee will reach $5.6 million.

229.title: Is Maha govt waiting for auspicious day for policy on clean school toilets: HC
229.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday asked Maharashtra state government if it was powerless or waiting for some auspicious day to frame a policy on the condition of toilets in schools. The court was hearing a plea filed by two students who stated Centre and State haven't implemented effective menstrual hygiene management. The plea stated washrooms were unclean in government-aided schools.

230.title: Thrissur, Nilambur & Warangal join UNESCO Global Network of Learning Cities
230.article_body: Kerala's Thrissur and Nilambur and Telangana's Warangal have joined the UNESCO Global Network of Learning Cities (GNLC), India at UNESCO has tweeted. UNESCO GNLC is an international policy-oriented network providing inspiration, know-how and best practice. Union Minister G Kishan Reddy congratulated Telangana and Warangal, saying that it's the state's "second recognition in...one year by UNESCO".

231.title: Himachal govt approves 6-month child adoption leave for women staff members
231.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh government has approved six-month child adoption leave for its regular women employees. The state cabinet approved the policy at a meeting that was chaired by state Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur. The government said that the nod for the leave has been given by adopting Rule 43-B of CCS (Leave) Rules, 1972.

232.title: Make love, not war: Russia-born man after marrying Ukrainian in India
232.article_body: A 37-year-old Russia-born man, Sergey Novikov, and his 28-year-old Ukrainian girlfriend, Alona Burmaka, registered their marriage in Dharamshala on Monday. On the occasion, Novikov said, "Once Russia and Ukraine were one nation, like brothers. We need to make love, not war." "When we came to India, we decided to marry...We like India and its culture," said the bride.

233.title: Police arrest man who became bogus surety for accused in Chandigarh
233.article_body: Chandigarh Police has arrested a man who became the false surety of accused in different district courts of Punjab and Chandigarh and helped them secure bail. The incident came to light after a man complained to police saying someone impersonated him to become bailiff of an accused arrested in a drugs case. The victim's Aadhaar number had been forged.

234.title: Shiv Sena will retain power in BMC despite BJP's plots: Ambadas Danve
234.article_body: Shiv Sena's Leader of Opposition in the Legislative Council, Ambadas Danve, said Maharashtra's new generation will remain with Shiv Sena despite BJP's machinations. "Shiv Sena will retain...power in BMC," he added. His remarks came after Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Eknath Shinde led-Shiv Sena and BJP will win 150 seats in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections.

235.title: File case against those defacing metro pillars with posters: Pune Metro to police
235.article_body: The Pune Metro has directed the local police to register cases against those defacing metro pillars with posters and other publicity materials. "We cannot keep a continuous watch on miscreants, so we have written to the local police as well as PMC...It is unfortunate that a few people are defacing metro property," Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation MD said.

236.title: PM Modi receives Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina at Rashtrapati Bhavan
236.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday received Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina as she arrived at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Sheikh Hasina began her four-day visit to India on Monday. "Our main focus is to develop our people's federation...I feel our two countries work together...people not only in India and Bangladesh but across South Asia can get better lives," she said.

237.title: 'Double XL' is very close to my heart, I'm proud of the film: Huma
237.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, speaking about her upcoming film 'Double XL', said that it's a film which is "very close" to her heart. "A film should have been made on this [subject] long ago. But we didn't make it, I do not know why. But I am very proud of that film," she added. The film will also star Sonakshi Sinha.

238.title: India sees 4,417 new COVID-19 cases, lowest since June; positivity rate drops to 1.20%
238.article_body: India has reported 4,417 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the lowest since June 2022, and 23 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,910 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 52,336, while the daily positivity rate declined to 1.20%.

239.title: Typhoon Hinnamnor leaves 20,000 homes without power in South Korea
239.article_body: Thousands of people were forced to evacuate as Typhoon Hinnamnor made landfall in South Korea on Tuesday. The typhoon has destroyed trees and roads, forced hundreds of flight cancellations and left more than 20,000 homes without power. South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol convened response meetings and urged officials to take precautions until the typhoon is completely gone.

240.title: Right time for Sri Lanka to be at their peak: Jaffer ahead of SL-India match
240.article_body: Ahead of the India-Sri Lanka match in Asia Cup today, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said it's the right time for the Dasun Shanaka-led side to be at their peak in the ongoing Asia Cup. "Looking at how they defeated Bangladesh and...Afghanistan...Sri Lanka's standards are touching a high," he added. Sri Lanka had lost to Afghanistan in the group stage.

241.title: I used to play Deepika, Khushi played SRK from 'Om..': Janhvi on childhood days
241.article_body: While talking about her childhood days, actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she and her sister Khushi Kapoor used to enact scene from 'Om Shanti Om'. "I used to also play the role of Deepika Padukone, and Khushi used to play the role of Shah Rukh Khan. We used to enact the scene...where Deepika waves at the audience," she added.

242.title: BJP, RSS gang is 'tukde-tukde gang' in real sense, says Congress
242.article_body: Congress spokesperson Ragini Nayak said BJP and RSS are the real "tukde-tukde gang" in the country. "I think that if there's a 'tukde-tukde gang' in a real sense in the country which is conspiring and ruining the social harmony, federal structure and democratic values to do 'tukde-tukde' of the country, it's the gang of BJP and Sangh," Nayak added.

243.title: Duo held for stealing cigarettes, medicines from delivery executives in Mumbai
243.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two people for allegedly following wholesale medicine delivery executives and stealing entire consignments. The police started a probe against the duo after a carton of 990 cigarettes was stolen on August 25. "The duo specialised in stealing medicines, knowing that they fetch a high price on black market, with other products like cigarettes," the police said.

244.title: Sensex jumps 300 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
244.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday with Sensex rising 300 points to 59,540 and Nifty at 17,747, up by 81 points. NTPC, IndusInd Bank, Reliance, Maruti, PowerGrid and Bharti Airtel were among the major gainers on BSE, while stocks of ITC, Wipro and Nestle India slipped. Buying was seen in power, realty, capital goods and auto stocks.

245.title: After 2024 polls we'll see non-BJP flag unfurled in India: KCR
245.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday said, "In 2024, we will see BJP-mukt Bharat. For this country, we should fight from Telangana." While addressing a gathering in Nizamabad, Rao added, "After 2024 Lok Sabha polls, we will see a non-BJP flag unfurled in India. We will send BJP to their home and will form a government in Delhi."

246.title: You put 6 airbags in exported cars then why just 4 in Indian units: Gadkari to car makers
246.article_body: Speaking in reference to the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry in a road accident, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari questioned car manufacturers. He said, "The same manufacturers put six airbags when they export those cars. Then why do you put only four airbags in Indian cars?" He added that the cost of increasing an airbag is ₹900.

247.title: Sachin Pilot urges Congress workers to not 'pull each other down'
247.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday urged party workers to not indulge in making "foul remarks" if they can't speak good about anyone. "We need to become each other's strength rather than pull each other down," he said. He also addressed the general public, saying, "If we can't shout slogans to cheer someone, let us at least not oppose them."

248.title: Who is Liz Truss, the leader who defeated Indian-origin Sunak in the UK PM race?
248.article_body: Liz Truss, the leader who defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race, studied philosophy, politics and economics at Merton College, Oxford. Truss has served as Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, and the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs in the past. She also worked in the energy and telecommunications industry for 10 years.

249.title: Mumbai man plans own robbery, held with partner who ran away with ₹13.75 lakh
249.article_body: Sumit Wadekar, an employee of a chartered accountancy firm in Mumbai was arrested for allegedly planning his own robbery along with his accomplice. The accomplice had, as per their plan, put a handkerchief on Wadekar's mouth and made him unconscious, following which, he ran away with ₹13.75 lakh. CCTV footage showed the two speaking to each other in sign language.

250.title: Over 27,000 Ganesh idols immersed in 5 days in Pune
250.article_body: A total of 27,375 Ganesh idols were immersed by the end of the fifth day of Ganeshotsav in Pune, with at least 15,832 of them being done on Sunday, said officials. The number is less as compared to last year, when at least 56,596 idols had been immersed by the fifth day of the festival, added officials.

251.title: Lalit Modi changes Instagram bio, sparks rumours of breakup with Sushmita Sen
251.article_body: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi has changed his Instagram bio, sparking rumours of breakup with Sushmita Sen. "Founder @iplt20 INDIAN PREMIER LEAGUE - finally starting a new life with my partner in crime. My love @sushmitasen47," his bio read until last week. However, on Monday, Lalit's Instagram bio dropped Sushmita's mention and read, "Founder @iplt20 INDIAN PREMIER LEAGUE - Moon."

252.title: Bengaluru Metro denied permission to cut more trees for now
252.article_body: The Karnataka High Court denied Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) permission to cut down more trees until it submits a status report on alternative plants raised earlier. The court gave BBMP two weeks time to file a report on the condition of compensatory plantation and dislocation of trees. This comes after BMRCL sought permission for felling 382 trees.

253.title: Russia jails ex-journalist Ivan Safronov for 22 years for treason
253.article_body: A Russian court has sentenced ex-journalist Ivan Safronov to 22 years in prison for treason. Ivan Safronov was accused of passing military secrets to Czech spies. He has denied the charges, claiming that information he allegedly shared with Czech foreign intelligence was all public and open source. Earlier, Safronov rejected a plea deal, which could have almost halved his sentence.

254.title: Arya Samaj certificates not enough to prove marriage, wedding must be registered: HC
254.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has observed that certificates issued by Arya Samaj Societies alone do not prove the legality of a marriage, saying the wedding should also be registered. While dealing with a habeas corpus petition, the High Court said, "The said institution has misused their beliefs in organising the marriages without even considering the genuineness of documents."

255.title: upGrad CEO shares video of him going to office on a tractor amid B'luru flooding
255.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's CEO Arjun Mohan has shared a video of him going to the office on a tractor amid heavy rainfall in Bengaluru. "I had to walk 7km, take a tractor to cross waist deep water and hitch rides from...bikers," Mohan wrote on LinkedIn. He clarified that he went to office because there was no electricity at his home.

256.title: Being called someone's girlfriend used to bother me: Actress Asha Negi
256.article_body: Actress Asha Negi said it used to bother her on being labelled someone's girlfriend and added she also has her own identity. "I've learnt that it's very important to keep your life private as much as you can...I've been here in the industry for some time now," she stated. Asha dated actor Rithvik Dhanjani, however, they broke up in 2020.

257.title: RIL acquires 79.4% stake in US-based solar software firm SenseHawk for $32m
257.article_body: Reliance Industries has acquired a 79.4% stake in US-based SenseHawk Inc through primary infusion and secondary purchase, for $32 million (₹255 crore), the company said in a BSE filing. Founded in 2018, SenseHawk develops software-based management tools for the solar energy generation industry. While the transaction will be completed by 2022-end, the deal marks RIL's foray into new energy.

258.title: Should have picked Deepak Chahar as Jadeja's replacement: Karim
258.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said pacer Deepak Chahar should've replaced Ravindra Jadeja in India's squad for the Asia Cup. "We already had three spinners in the squad...Chahar is a specialist in the T20 format and is a wicket-taker," stated Karim. Jadeja was replaced by Axar Patel after he was ruled out due to a right knee injury.

259.title: Pune women gang that stole mobile phones during Ganesh festival busted
259.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a women gang that stole mobile phones during the Ganesh festival and arrested its four members. Police recovered four mobile phones, worth ₹97,000, from them. "These women are habitual offenders and visit the city during big festivals like Ganpati, where large crowds come on the streets. They stay on footpaths...later sell the phones," police stated.

260.title: 2 die, 1 injured after overspeeding bike hits divider in Navi Mumbai
260.article_body: Two people died and one was seriously injured after their motorbike hit a divider on Palm Beach Road in Navi Mumbai. The incident reportedly occurred at around 11 pm on Sunday. According to police, the motorbike was being driven at a very high speed, which led to the accident. The injured person is being treated at a hospital, reports said.

261.title: Noise level crosses 'danger' mark in Mumbai during Ganpati Visarjan: NGO
261.article_body: The drums and loudspeakers used during Ganpati Visarjan this year contributed to making the noise level the highest ever in Mumbai, crossing the 'danger' mark, a city-based NGO said. According to data shared by Awaaz Foundation, the combination of drums and banjo used in processions created the highest noise at 115.6dB at Marine Drive's Babulnath corner and 112.1dB in Bandra.

262.title: People think back-seaters don't need belt: Gadkari after Cyrus Mistry's death
262.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said the mindset of the common man needs to change to increase road safety. He said, "People think back-seaters don't need belts. It is the problem." Police probe into former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death in the road accident on Sunday revealed he was in the backseat and was not wearing a seat belt.

263.title: 'No': US Prez Biden on designating Russia as state sponsor of terror
263.article_body: On being asked if Russia should be designated a state sponsor of terrorism, US President Joe Biden told reporters at the White House, "No." Ukraine's government has asked its Western partners to designate Russia as a "terrorist state" amid Moscow's ongoing invasion. Earlier, Russia had warned the US that such designation would rupture ties between both countries.

264.title: He kept a low profile despite his success: Shapoorji Pallonji Group on Mistry's death
264.article_body: After the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry in a road accident, Shapoorji Pallonji Group shared a condolence letter on social media. It wrote, "CPM, as he was fondly known, was a voracious reader, committed to a journey of lifelong learning across multiple disciplines. Despite his success, he always kept a low profile, away from the limelight."

265.title: Telugu is the new Hindi: RGV on 'Brahmastra' promotions in South
265.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter and talked about the promotions of 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad involving 'Baahubali' director SS Rajamouli and 'RRR' actor Jr NTR. "Going by Rajamouli and Jr NTR at the 'Brahmastra' event, Telugu is the new Hindi," Varma tweeted. 'Brahmastra' features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and Nagarjuna. The film will release on September 9.

266.title: ATM refilling van driver flees with ₹2.80 cr cash in Mumbai, booked
266.article_body: The driver of an ATM refilling van allegedly fled with ₹2.80 crore cash in the vehicle in Mumbai on Monday. The incident occurred around 12.20 pm when the van reached Union Bank of India in Goregaon (west) and the employees got off the van to refill the ATM, police said. An FIR has been filed in connection with the case.

267.title: Pune residents asked to update Aadhaar, Collector calls for drive
267.article_body: Residents in Pune have been asked to update their information on Aadhaar. District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh on Monday called for a drive in this regard. "Many citizens have changed their addresses. Hence, we appeal to all residents to update information," said Deshmukh. Notably, Pune is one of the 40 districts selected by the central government for updating Aadhaar cards.

268.title: 2 members of drug cartel held in Delhi, 4.2 kg heroin worth ₹21 cr seized
268.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two members of an interstate drug cartel and seized 4.2 kilograms of heroin worth ₹21 crore. The cartel allegedly supplied more than 100 kilograms of heroin in Delhi in the past two years, police said. One of the accused used to prepare heroin in his village in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, police further said.

269.title: Man running India-Pak cricket betting racket arrested in Pune
269.article_body: Pune City Police's crime branch unit 3 has arrested a 24-year-old man who was running a cricket betting racket during the India-Pakistan match. The arrest was made after police officers patrolling in Kothrud got a tip-off that the accused was standing near a pub, police said. Previously, the accused was arrested for running a betting racket in Pimpri-Chinchwad, police added.

270.title: Lucknow's Hotel Levana to be sealed, demolished after 4 people killed in fire
270.article_body: Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow will be sealed and demolished, following the death of four people in a fire that broke out at the hotel on Monday. The owners of the hotel have been detained. Rescue work had started soon after fire broke out. Reports said that the hotel operators had not taken the NOC of the fire department.

271.title: Bengaluru reports 276 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
271.article_body: Bengaluru reported 276 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,66,836 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 3,228, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.57%.

272.title: Highest rainfall in B'luru in 32 yrs; K'taka govt releases ₹300 cr to tackle flooding
272.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that Bengaluru has received the highest rainfall in the last 32 years. The state government has decided to release ₹300 crore to tackle the flooding in Bengaluru amid heavy rain, he added. The released money will be used to restore infrastructure such as roads, electric poles, transformers and schools, among others, Bommai stated.

273.title: One suspect in Canada mass stabbing that killed 10 found dead
273.article_body: Canada police have said that one of the two suspects in Sunday's mass stabbing in Saskatchewan has been found dead. The other suspect, his brother, was still on the run and may be injured, officials added. The brothers Damien and Myles Sanderson are suspected of murdering 10 people and wounding 18 in the attack that targeted an indigenous community.

274.title: Russia permanently bans 25 Americans, including Sean Penn, from entering the country
274.article_body: Russia imposed personal sanctions on 25 Americans, including actors Sean Penn and Ben Stiller, in response to US sanctions against Russians amid Ukraine war. Russia said the group, which also includes business leaders, academics and government officials, would be banned permanently from entering Russia. Notably, Penn and Stiller previously traveled to Ukraine and met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

275.title: Heard of Piastri-McLaren contract later than July 4 date: Alpine F1
275.article_body: Alpine F1 boss Otmar Szafnauer said they got to know about Oscar Piastri and McLaren's contract much later than the July 4 date they claimed to have signed the deal. "Up until that point, it was just conjecture," said Szafnauer, adding they were pursuing their contract with Piastri. An F1 Board recently ruled in favour of Piastri's contract with McLaren.

276.title: Priti Patel resigns as UK Home Secretary hours after Liz Truss named PM
276.article_body: Britain's Home Secretary Priti Patel on Monday announced she's stepping down from her post, hours after Liz Truss was named the Prime Minister. "I congratulate Liz Truss on being elected our new Leader, and will give her my support as our new Prime Minister," said Patel in her resignation letter. "It's my choice to continue...public service...from the backbenches," said Patel.

277.title: SEBI gives in-principle approval to Helios Capital for mutual fund business
277.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has given in-principle approval to Helios Capital to launch a mutual fund business. The portfolio management services business, Helios Capital Management PTE Limited, applied for a mutual fund license in February 2021. Founder and Fund Manager Samir Arora announced the approval on Twitter and added that they will focus on performance and service.

278.title: With Medvedev out, Nadal leading race to end US Open as world no. 1
278.article_body: Daniil Medvedev is set to be replaced as world number one by Rafael Nadal, Carlos Alcaraz or Casper Ruud after the US Open. With Medvedev losing to Nick Kyrgios in the Round of 16, Rafael Nadal would become the top-ranked player if he reaches the finals. Ruud or Alcaraz could also take the spot if they win the tournament.

279.title: Tripura CM meets PM Modi, discusses state issues
279.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi. Saha said that he told the PM about the progress of various projects in health, education, commerce, infrastructure development and ongoing projects of central and state governments. "Hon'ble PM assured about extending Centre's necessary assistance for overall development in Tripura," Saha wrote on Twitter.

280.title: Macron urges French to save energy amid EU-Russia tensions
280.article_body: Amid tensions between Russia and the EU over the war in Ukraine, French President Emmanuel Macron has urged the people of his country to adopt energy-saving measures in order to avoid power cuts during winter. Macron on Monday warned that power rationing could be introduced if voluntary efforts don't suffice. He added that "cuts will happen as a last resort".

281.title: Minimum 2 more years in F1, then Dakar Rally: Fernando Alonso
281.article_body: Two-time F1 world champion Fernando Alonso said he wishes to continue in the sport for a minimum of two more years. "And then, from there, a challenge that I have never hidden is to try the Dakar (Rally) again," said Alonso. He added that he was moving to Aston Martin from Alpine next year because he felt more wanted there.

282.title: Getting threats for doing Ganesh Puja at home: UP BJP's Ruby Khan
282.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Muslim BJP leader Ruby Asif Khan allegedly received death threats for bringing home and worshipping a Ganesh idol. A fatwa has also reportedly been issued against her by Deoband Mufti Arshad Farooqui who called her action 'un-Islamic'. Stating that she is not afraid of the threats, she said she would also immerse the Ganesh idol with due diligence.

283.title: Real Madrid's Brazilian attacker Vinicius Jr adopts Spain citizenship
283.article_body: Real Madrid attacker Vinicius Junior, who holds a Brazilian passport, has now also adopted Spanish citizenship. Under La Liga rules, a club can only have five non-EU players in their squad, thus Vinicius' move helps free up a spot for Real Madrid. Reports claim players Rodrygo Goes and Eder Militao are also in the process of obtaining their Spanish passports.

284.title: 'India's biggest car thief' who stole over 5,000 cars in 24 years, arrested in Delhi
284.article_body: An auto theft kingpin, whom the police referred to as "India's biggest car thief", was arrested by Delhi Police on Monday. Anil Chauhan, who started stealing cars in 1998, has looted over 5,000 cars across the country and police found illegal firearms and ammunition with him. Around 180 criminal cases including rhino horn smuggling and murders are registered against him.

285.title: Ukrainian PM asks EU for more weapons, offers gas supplies
285.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Monday urged the EU to provide Ukraine with more weapons in order to strengthen its capabilities in the ongoing war against Russia. Shmyhal further suggested that Ukraine could supply the gas that the EU needs to reduce its dependence on Russia. Notably, Russia last week indefinitely suspended gas supply to Europe through a key pipeline.

286.title: Contractual Army cook arrested for stalking minor on social media
286.article_body: A 21-year-old contractual cook of the Indian Army was arrested by Delhi Police for allegedly stalking and harassing a 17-year-old girl on social media after she ended their friendship. The girl had befriended him through TikTok and exchanged numbers, police said. The accused allegedly created her multiple fake accounts on social media platforms and made vulgar posts using her pictures.

287.title: Find music & acting to be opposite in many ways: Harry Styles
287.article_body: Singer-actor Harry Styles said he finds acting and creating music "kind of opposite in a lot of ways". The actor said making music is a "really personal thing", while acting is mostly about "playing pretend". "Music I've done for longer, but what I like about acting is I feel like I have no idea what I'm doing," he said.

288.title: It was beautiful, hats off to groundsmen: Ravi on pitch in Ind-Pak game
288.article_body: Cricket commentator Ravi Shastri said that the pitch in the India-Pakistan match at the Dubai International Stadium was "beautiful". "What...Rohit [Sharma and KL] Rahul...were doing. Where were the runs coming? It was down the ground and in the V," Shastri said. He added, "It was a beautiful pitch, hats off to the groundsmen, the ball was skidding onto the bat."

289.title: Amazon looking to enter prescription drug market in Japan: Report
289.article_body: Amazon Inc is reportedly looking to enter the prescription drug market in Japan. Next year, when electronic prescriptions are allowed for the first time in Japan, Amazon plans to partner with small and mid-sized pharmacies to provide the service. Currently, the government of Japan sets the price cap for prescription drugs in a highly fragmented distribution system.

290.title: We are a democratic party, people can air their views openly: Cong
290.article_body: The Congress asserted that it is a democratic party and allows leaders to express themselves following criticism by the BJP and former member Ghulam Nabi Azad. "Some (leaders) write letters, some tweet, some give an interview...There is no dictatorship...we don't silence anyone," said Jairam Ramesh. Both BJP and Azad had told the Congress to concentrate on uniting the party first.

291.title: 80-yr-old Congress leader from Haridwar, Harpal Sathi, joins BJP
291.article_body: Senior Congress leader from Haridwar, Harpal Singh Sathi, joined BJP along with his supporters in the presence of Uttarakhand BJP President Mahendra Bhatt. On joining BJP, 80-year-old Sathi said that the BJP was his family and he was returning to it after realising his mistake. Sathi is a three-time former MP from Haridwar and won twice on a BJP ticket.

292.title: Funding winter for startups to continue for 12-18 months: Report
292.article_body: According to a report by market intelligence platform Tracxn, funding winter (low investor confidence in startups) in India is likely to continue for the next 12-18 months. The report added that August 2022 saw $885 million in funding, which was down 20% compared to July 2022. In the maximum total funding raised, Bengaluru was in the lead, the report stated.

293.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for August?
293.article_body: The ICC on Monday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of August. England's Ben Stokes, Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza and New Zealand's Mitchell Santner have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while Australia's Beth Mooney and Tahlia McGrath, and India's Jemimah Rodrigues have been nominated in the women's category.

294.title: Seema Sajdeh reacts to troll saying she's 'no more a B'wood wife' after divorce
294.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema Sajdeh, who recently got divorced from actor-filmmaker Sohail Khan, responded to a troll who asked why she is still a part of the show as she is no longer a 'Bollywood wife'. "I didn't know women were defined by their husbands and their last name. Is that their only identity?" Seema said.

295.title: Teachers, your contribution to society is priceless: Kohli on Teachers' Day
295.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter on the occasion of Teachers' Day on Monday and wrote, "To all our teachers and mentors, your contribution to our society is priceless." Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Amongst all the education and morals my teachers sincerely imparted, I'm most grateful to them for teaching me...values of hard work, honesty and never giving up."

296.title: Nataraj idol stolen from Tamil Nadu temple 62 yrs ago traced to US
296.article_body: A Nataraj idol, stolen 62 years ago from a temple in Tamil Nadu’s Thanjavur, was traced to New York, USA by the CID’s idol wing. After thieves broke into the 2000-year-old temple and stole an idol, the CID found that it is fake and the original was missing. Officials said the original idol is being retrieved under UNESCO agreements.

297.title: Pics of revamped Central Vista Avenue released ahead of inauguration this week
297.article_body: New pictures of the refurbished Central Vista Avenue in New Delhi have been released ahead of its scheduled inauguration on September 8 (Thursday). The pictures show red granite walkways, revamped canals and a fountain amid lush greenery. Food stalls from all the different states will be put up in the area when it is thrown open to the public.

298.title: Chip in car can give vital info on Cyrus Mistry's accident: Police
298.article_body: Just like an aircraft's blackbox, Mercedes cars have a chip that can give details of the speed and can provide vital information of the accident that killed former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, police said. This comes after the car Mistry was travelling in was inspected by Mercedes officials. The accident spot and vehicle were also inspected by forensic experts.

299.title: Speeding truck kills police constable in Jaipur; driver arrested
299.article_body: A police constable died after being hit by a speeding truck on the Jaipur-Delhi national highway near Daulatpura village in Jaipur, Rajasthan. The deceased, Dharmendra Kumar (37), was part of an interceptor and died while trying to stop the truck for over speed, police said. Notably, the truck driver has been arrested and the vehicle seized, police added.

300.title: Girl kills father with grinding stone in Ghaziabad to save mother
300.article_body: A 16-year-old girl killed her father with a grinding stone in Ghaziabad after being fed up with him beating her mother with a belt. The teenager and mother have both been booked for murder. During interrogation, the woman said that the man was having an affair and used to regularly beat her and the children, said police.

301.title: 5 arrested for ransacking traffic police booth in Chennai
301.article_body: Five people have been arrested for allegedly ransacking a traffic police booth in Chennai. According to police, a construction supervisor was attacked by some people after he tried to stop one of them from stealing construction materials. The supervisor ran to the booth to escape. The attackers then hurled stones at the booth and damaged its windows and doors.

302.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant disconnected from power grid: Ukraine
302.article_body: Ukraine's electricity grid lost connection with the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant as the result of a fire caused by Russian shelling on Monday, the plant's operator Energoatom said. The reserve line through which power was being supplied to the grid "was deliberately disconnected in order to extinguish a fire", the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said citing Ukrainian authorities.

303.title: There was no need to play that shot: Akram on Pant's dismissal
303.article_body: Former cricketer Wasim Akram commented on India's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's dismissal against Pakistan on Sunday after the latter got out playing a reverse sweep shot. "At that stage of the game, there was no need to play that shot. I know he plays that shot in Test cricket...but in this stage of the game, that shot wasn't required," Akram said.

304.title: Saying nasty things about him does nobody any good: Bhogle on Arshdeep
304.article_body: Defending Arshdeep Singh after the pacer got abused on social media for dropping a catch in India's five-wicket defeat against Pakistan at Asia Cup, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Saying nasty things about Arshdeep does nobody any good." He added, "We've all made mistakes under pressure. This is the time to back him. He will win India a lot of matches."

305.title: Joined BJP as our win in Manipur was mandate to NDA: Ex-JD(U) legislators
305.article_body: We joined BJP as our win in the Manipur Assembly elections was a mandate to the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), the five former JD(U) legislators who joined BJP on Friday said. "We fought elections for the NDA government...We joined BJP as we had no option as [JD(U)] withdrew from the NDA," said Joykisan Singh, one of the legislators.

306.title: M Venture Partners raises over $25 mn for MVP Fund I
306.article_body: Singapore-based early-stage venture capital (VC) fund M Venture Partners (MVP) has raised an additional capital of over $25 million. The total capital allocated to MVP Fund I companies is now more than $55 million. Launched in 2019, MVP Fund I has now invested in 30 companies across Southeast Asia and India, and its portfolio companies include Naluri, Liquide and NewCampus.

307.title: I wake up in disbelief that this is my life, that I'm an actor: Ranveer Singh
307.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said, "I'm...grateful that I get to be an actor and that's actually enough for me." "I've always said...it's a miracle that I even became an actor," he added. "Every day, I wake up in disbelief that this is my life, that I'm an actor and I get to do these things, collaborate with...talented filmmakers," Ranveer said.

308.title: Anyone chosen as Cong Prez by consensus acceptable to G-23: Chavan
308.article_body: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan said a party President chosen by consensus would be acceptable to the G-23 dissenters. He said the President could be Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot or any leader if chosen by general agreement. He also backed Shashi Tharoor's demand to make public the electoral rolls of the Congress President polls to be held on October 17.

309.title: Brendan Fraser breaks down as The Whale gets 6-min standing ovation at film fest
309.article_body: Actor Brendan Fraser, known for 'The Mummy' films, broke into tears after his film 'The Whale' received a six-minute-long standing ovation at Venice Film Festival 2022. The film, directed by Darren Aronofsky, features Brendan as a 600-pound (over 270 kg) gay professor who tries to reconnect with his 17-year-old daughter. The film was screened at the festival on September 4.

310.title: Windfall tax on petroleum products, crude isn't ad hoc: Sitharaman
310.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said windfall tax on petroleum products and crude is not ad hoc. She said that it's being charged in regular consultation with the industry. The tax rate and its resetting are done in complete consultations with the industry, she said, adding, "The very idea was implemented after taking the industry into full confidence."

311.title: Film will be new & fresh: Ayan on fans' concern on 'Brahmastra' promos
311.article_body: 'Brahmastra: Part One-Shiva' makers have been sharing new promos of the film ahead of its release, which has left the fans concerned. On Monday, Ayan Mukerji addressed the fans' concerns and told them not to worry as the film will be "new and fresh" on screen. He assured fans that the "actual movie is a whole other experience".

312.title: Didn't get India's team selection or playing style: Shoaib Akhtar
312.article_body: Former Pakistani bowler Shoaib Akhtar said he is "confused" with India's team selection and manner of playing. "India's team came across a very confusing selection for me...whoever is coming, is just hitting...someone has to anchor the innings," said Akhtar. He added that after Pakistan's first match loss, he had told everyone that they would beat India "ruthlessly" next time.

313.title: Nuclear-capable US bombers fly over Middle East amid tensions with Iran
313.article_body: Amid tensions between Washington and Tehran, the US said that a pair of its nuclear-capable B-52 long-distance bombers made a sortie over the Middle East on Sunday. The bombers took off from an airbase in England and flew over the eastern Mediterranean, the Arabian Peninsula and the Red Sea with Saudi and Kuwaiti warplanes as part of a training mission.

314.title: I want to generate jobs, but some are obstructing by filing PILs: Mamata
314.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she wants to "generate jobs" for the aspirants of the School Service Commission (SSC) but some people are "obstructing" the process and filing PILs for the same. "Some people want to politicise the matter and are filing PILs to stop the process. If you file cases, the process will take time," she said.

315.title: Kanye was upset that I supported Joe Biden over him as President: John Legend
315.article_body: Singer John Legend said Kanye West was "very upset" with him after he supported Joe Biden over him in the 2020 US presidential election. Kanye announced his presidential election campaign in July 2020. In reference to his friendship with Ye, John said he believes that "relationships with people shouldn't only be determined by who they voted for".

316.title: Hope Lewandowski can win the Ballon d'Or in 2022: Puyol
316.article_body: Ex-Barcelona captain Carles Puyol said he hopes Robert Lewandowski can win the Ballon d'Or this year. "He deserves it for the good years he has had and now he has to win it at Barcelona. It'll be a good sign," he added. "He's one of the best strikers in...world," he further said. Barcelona signed Lewandowski from Bayern Munich in July.

317.title: Will shave my beard after 8 years if I win 2nd World Cup: France's Giroud
317.article_body: France forward Oliver Giroud said he would "have to do something a little crazy" and shave his beard if he won the World Cup for the second time. "It's been a long time, it's been almost eight years," said Giroud about shaving his beard. Defending champions France will open their 2022 FIFA World Cup campaign on November 22 against Australia.

318.title: Revenue-based financing firm Klub closes ₹200 cr maiden fund
318.article_body: Revenue-based financing platform Klub announced the final close of its maiden ₹200 crore fund, Aceler8. It is a SEBI-registered Category II Alternative Investment Fund and has already deployed 30% of its corpus. The fund invests capital between ₹5 lakh to ₹30 crore in businesses for up to 24 months and has made 33 investments over the last few months.

319.title: Had no money to celebrate b'day when I was young, now I've no desire: Pankaj
319.article_body: Pankaj Tripathi, who turned 46 on Monday, remembered that when he was young, he didn't have money to enjoy his special day. Now, when he can afford to celebrate his birthday, Tripathi said he has no desire to make noise. "The age to enjoy birthdays is gone," he said, adding, "A quiet day with the family is all I want."

320.title: India are playing good cricket: SL captain Shanaka ahead of Asia Cup game
320.article_body: Ahead of India-Sri Lanka Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022, Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka said India have been playing good cricket. "They (India) had a great game last night...I don't think they will be under pressure," he added. The match will be played on Tuesday. Sri Lanka are currently on top of the Super 4 points table.

321.title: Healthledger Diagnostics raises undisclosed amount of seed funding
321.article_body: Healthledger Diagnostics has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from angel investors and venture capitalists. The transactions were enabled by Quadra Capital Advisors and include VCs Nitish Mittersain and Vikash Mittersain of Nazara Technologies and lifestyle coach Luke Coutinho, among others, the company said. The firm claims to have generated $1 million revenue in its inception year.

322.title: Central govt provide armed CISF cover to RSS offices in Delhi
322.article_body: The RSS offices in Delhi have been provided with an armed Central Industrial Security Force cover by the Central government. According to PTI, the organisation's main 'Keshav Kunj' office located at Jhandewalan and its camp office located nearby at 'Udasin Ashram' have been brought under the CISF cover beginning September 1. Notably, the cover was sanctioned by the Home Ministry.

323.title: Court not a tool for your resume: HC to student who sought ₹15 lakh over pollution in Delhi
323.article_body: Dismissing his petition seeking grant of ₹15-lakh compensation from the government on the ground of air pollution in Delhi, the High Court told a law student that the right to file a case before the court is not merely a tool for resume. "Sir remember, the court is a serious place," Justice Yashwant Varma told the petitioner.

324.title: Can students wear minis in colleges?: SC while hearing plea against hijab ban
324.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Hemant Gupta asked if students were allowed to dress in "minis, midis, whatever they want" in colleges while hearing a plea challenging the ban on hijab in government colleges in Karnataka. The apex court bench said, "They (authorities) are not denying the right to education. What they are saying as State, is you come in the uniform."

325.title: Jaffer, Mishra troll Barmy Army for calling Ashes bigger than India-Pakistan rivalry
325.article_body: Wasim Jaffer and Amit Mishra trolled England's Barmy Army for tweeting, "Ashes > India vs Pakistan anyway." Jaffer wrote, "If I was an England fan, with the Ashes record England has, I'd downplay the Ashes if anything." Meanwhile, Mishra posted a picture of Russian President Vladimir Putin and ex-England captain Nasser Hussain and wrote, "Difference between #IndvsPak & Ashes."

326.title: You inspire me so much: Kriti Sanon on Pankaj Tripathi's birthday
326.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Monday wished Pankaj Tripathi on his birthday. Taking to her Instagram Stories, she wrote, "Happy Birthday Pankaj Sir! You inspire me so much...Have done a few of my best films with you and I hope I get to do many more!" The duo have worked together in films like 'Bachchhan Paandey', 'Mimi' and 'Bareilly Ki Barfi'.

327.title: SRK's Red Chillies acquires remake rights of 'Dulhe Raja': Reports
327.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment has reportedly acquired the negative and remake rights of 1998 film 'Dulhe Raja'. As per reports, director Farhad Samji is working on the script of the film. "If the screenplay is faithful adaptation and actors show keen interest, Red Chillies will be more than happy to remake the film," a source informed Pinkvilla.

328.title: Can’t expect govt to provide security to pvt hospitals: Supreme Court
328.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said it can't be expected from the central and state governments to provide security to private hospitals. It was hearing a plea seeking direction to the government to ensure adequate security at hospitals to prevent attacks on doctors. "The private centres must make their own security arrangement. You cannot burden the government," the court said.

329.title: Fans get emotional and say a few words, we don't have a problem: Arshdeep Singh's father
329.article_body: Talking about his son getting abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup, India pacer Arshdeep Singh's father Darshan Singh said, "Fans get emotional, angry when their team loses and say a few words." He added, "We're taking it positively and there's no problem." "People have a habit to say...let them say," Arshdeep's mother said.

330.title: Instagram fined $400 million by Ireland for violating children's privacy
330.article_body: Meta-owned Instagram has been fined €405 million (around $402 million) for allegedly violating children's privacy, including the publication of children's email addresses and phone numbers. The fine has been levied by the Irish DPC and is the second highest fine under the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Instagram is the third Meta-owned company fined by the Irish DPC.

331.title: Ricky Ponting names his 5 players for World T20I XI
331.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has named the first five players he would choose in his world T20I XI. He included Afghanistan's Rashid Khan, Pakistan's Babar Azam, India's Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah, and England's Jos Buttler. "Right now he's probably the best all-rounder in the world in T20 cricket, and could potentially be in ODI cricket," Ponting said about Pandya.

332.title: 2 dead, many missing after boat with 23 fishermen capsizes in Kerala
332.article_body: Two fishermen were killed and many went missing after a boat carrying about 23 people capsized near Anchuthengu Harbour in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Monday. According to police, 16 people have been rescued so far. The injured were shifted to Chirayinkeezhu hospital for treatment. The Indian Coast Guard and locals are searching for the missing persons.

333.title: 19-year-old Palestinian man shot dead by Israeli forces
333.article_body: A 19-year-old Palestinian man was killed in a clash with Israeli forces that broke out during an arrest raid in West Bank on Monday, Palestinian officials said. Israeli military said that its soldiers resorted to retaliatory firing after the man threw a firebomb at troops from close range. Militant group Islamic Jihad claimed that the deceased was one its members.

334.title: Journalist Shireen Abu Akleh likely killed by soldier: Israeli army
334.article_body: The Israeli army on Monday announced the results of its investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, saying it was "highly possible" that she was killed by an Israeli soldier's gunfire. However, no one would be punished as the shooting was accidental, army added. Akleh was killed in May while covering a military raid in West Bank.

335.title: India's monetary policy will remain watchful, calibrated: RBI Guv
335.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that India's monetary policy will remain watchful, nimble-footed and calibrated going forward. He further said India's central bank has intervened in forex markets to prevent excessive volatility in the exchange rate. He noted that the Indian rupee had moved in an orderly manner during sharp depreciations in other currencies.

336.title: Football-size tumour removed from Nepalese woman's stomach in Delhi
336.article_body: A football-size tumour, weighing around four kg, was removed from the stomach of a 32-year-old woman from Nepal at a private hospital in Delhi. The woman had come to the hospital with complaints of extreme pain and an oversized stomach. A doctor said that removing the tumour was like delivering a large size baby as in a caesarean section.

337.title: Mastercard replaces Paytm as BCCI's title sponsor for 2022-23 season
337.article_body: Global payments giant Mastercard has replaced Paytm as the title sponsor of the Board of Control for Cricket in India. Mastercard has announced that it has acquired the BCCI's title sponsorship rights for all international (both women and men) and domestic matches for the 2022-23 season. Notably, Paytm held the rights for seven years as the title sponsor of BCCI.

338.title: Wimbledon finalist Jabeur reaches her first-ever quarter-final at US Open
338.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Ons Jabeur defeated 18th seed Veronika Kudermetova 7-6(7-1), 6-4 in the fourth round to enter her maiden quarter-final at US Open. "It was a very difficult match," said Jabeur. Notably, the Tunisian became the first Arab woman to reach the last eight in New York. Jabeur will now face Ajla Tomljanovic, who beat Liudmila Samsonova 7-6(10-8), 6-1.

339.title: Platforms like Twitter can't decide what is free speech: Centre to HC
339.article_body: The Centre told the High Court on Thursday that intermediary platforms like Twitter can't "define what free speech is and what's not". Twitter's petition challenging action against multiple handles is not maintainable, the Centre said while adding that Twitter's content management policies are "a failure". Twitter isn't taking effective steps to prevent the spread of fake news, the Centre said.

340.title: We have left behind those who ruled us for 250 years: PM Modi
340.article_body: As India surpassed the UK to become the fifth-largest economy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said, "Achieving this spot is special as we have left behind those who ruled over us for 250 years." The PM was interacting with National Award-winning teachers. "Our new National Education Policy (NEP) is being applauded throughout the world," PM Modi added.

341.title: Vijay Deverakonda's 'Jana Gana Mana' shelved following Liger's box office failure: Report
341.article_body: Following Liger's box office failure, Vijay Deverakonda's next film 'Jana Gana Mana', which was also to be directed by Puri Jagannadh, has been shelved, Hindustan Times reported. As per trade sources, Liger managed to earn just ₹35 crore across India in its opening weekend. Earlier, it was announced that 'Jana Gana Mana' will be released in August 2023.

342.title: Odisha Juggernauts win the inaugural edition of Ultimate Kho Kho
342.article_body: Odisha Juggernauts won the title at the inaugural edition of Ultimate Kho Kho after beating Telugu Yoddhas 46-45 in the final in Pune on Sunday. Odisha Juggernauts were awarded ₹1 crore in prize money, while the second-placed Telugu Yoddhas won ₹50 lakh. Gujarat Giants bagged ₹30 lakh for their third-place finish.

343.title: Can't you see it's a throwback photo, chomu aadmi: Sanjana to troll over pic with Bumrah
343.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's wife, TV presenter Sanjana Ganesan, responded to a troll who commented on her Instagram picture with Bumrah. "Waha India ki *** ***** pade hue hai or yeh gum rahe," the troll wrote, mocking Bumrah for not being in India squad for Asia Cup. Sanjana responded, "It's a throwback photo, can't you see, chomu aadmi?"

344.title: He looked very good: Gambhir on Kohli's 60 vs Pakistan at Asia Cup
344.article_body: Commenting on India batter Virat Kohli's 44-ball 60 against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir said, "Kohli looked very, very good." He added, "Kohli...coming back after the way he batted in...first and second game just showed that probably he got that confidence back especially today." It was Kohli's second consecutive half-century in the tournament.

345.title: 60-80% Twitter accounts posting on Russia-Ukraine war may be bots: Study
345.article_body: A research by scholars from Australia's University of Adelaide has revealed that between 60-80% of Twitter handles posting on the Russia-Ukraine war may be bot accounts. These bot accounts may have been pushing people to flee their homes during the conflict, the research said. Of accounts tweeting on the war, 90.16% were "pro Ukraine" while only 6.8% were "pro Russia".

346.title: Tonight you saw, rankings don't matter: Kyrgios on beating world no. 1 Medvedev
346.article_body: After defeating world number one and defending champion Daniil Medvedev in the fourth round at US Open 2022, world number 25 Nick Kyrgios said, "Tonight was another message that the rankings don't matter." He added, "I don't care whether I'm seeded or not. It's nice otherwise I could draw him [in] first round." Kyrgios beat Medvedev 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

347.title: India's external debt grew by 8.2% in 2021-22: Finance Ministry
347.article_body: India's external debt grew by 8.2% to $620.70 billion on March 31, 2022, from $573.7 billion a year ago, Union Finance Ministry said. External debt as a ratio to GDP fell marginally to 19.9% at the end of March 2022, it added. Foreign currency reserves as a ratio to external debt stood slightly lower at 97.8% as of March-end 2022.

348.title: India to design, build reusable rocket for global market: ISRO
