348.article_body: India has plans to design and build a new reusable rocket for the global market, that would significantly cut the cost of launching satellites, a senior Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) official said on Monday. “All of us want launches to be much cheaper than what we do today,” ISRO Chairman S Somanath further said.

349.title: 14,500 schools to be developed, upgraded: PM Modi on Teachers' Day
349.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on the occasion of Teachers' Day on Monday announced that 14,500 schools across India will be developed and upgraded under the Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) Yojana. "These will become model schools which will encapsulate the full spirit of [National Education Policy]," he said. These will put emphasis on a discovery-oriented, learning-centric way of teaching.

350.title: American filmmaker Gunn reacts to Chiranjeevi's 'Mr Batman' avatar in old song
350.article_body: American filmmaker James Gunn, known for films like 'Guardians of the Galaxy' and 'The Suicide Squad', has shared a video of a song from Chiranjeevi's 1993 Telugu film 'Mutamestri'. In the video shared by Gunn, the actor could be seen dancing in a Batman costume. "First there was Batman, then The Batman, and now MR. BATMAN," Gunn wrote.

351.title: Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan rejects 'Bigg Boss 16'
351.article_body: Actor Faissal Khan, brother of Aamir Khan, took to Instagram to share a video revealing that he was approached for Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' but he rejected the offer. He added that he was also offered a TV show. "I'm quite excited...people are...considering me. Please pray for me...I get some good work so I can...entertain you all," said Faissal.

352.title: Bihar's political upheaval unlikely to have nationwide impact: Prashant Kishor
352.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday said that the political upheaval in Bihar, which saw JD(U) breaking its alliance with BJP, was a "state-specific" phenomenon and is unlikely to have a nationwide effect. Kishor added that the upheaval was symbolic of the "political instability" that has plagued Bihar since the rise of the "new BJP" under PM Narendra Modi's leadership.

353.title: 11-yr-old missing boy found dead inside a madrasa in Haryana
353.article_body: An 11-year-old boy was found dead inside a madrasa in Shah Chaukha village in Haryana's Nuh district. The deceased, Sameer, went missing from the same Madrasa on Saturday and police recovered his decomposed body from an old room. Half of the deceased's body was covered with sand, the complaint said. Sameer was staying and studying in the madrasa since 2021.

354.title: Free power supply to all farmers if non-BJP govt comes in 2024: KCR
354.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday announced "free power supply to all farmers in the country if a non-BJP government comes to power in 2024". He was speaking at a public meeting in Nizamabad. Days ago at another event, Rao had called for "BJP-mukt Bharat". He had said the BJP was responsible for all major problems afflicting the country.

355.title: Indian Army chief Gen Pande made honorary General of Nepali Army
355.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was conferred the honorary rank of "General of the Nepali Army" by Nepal's President Bidya Devi Bhandari on Monday. The practice follows the seven-decade-old tradition between India and Nepal where both countries confer the title of honorary General to each other's army chiefs. General Pande is currently on a five-day official visit to Nepal.

356.title: India's services sector PMI grows from 4-month low to 57.2 in Aug
356.article_body: India's services sector saw improvement in August from a four-month low Purchasing Managers' Index in July. The S&P Global India Services PMI rose to 57.2 in August from July's 55.5. "Business confidence strengthened substantially, reaching its highest since May 2018, while employment rose at...fastest pace in over 14 years," Pollyanna De Lima, Economics Associate Director at S&P Global said.

357.title: Delhi L-G sends legal notice to Atishi, other AAP leaders for defamation
357.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Monday sent a legal notice to AAP leaders, including MLAs Atishi and Saurabh Bharadwaj, for levelling "derogatory" charges against him. Earlier, AAP had alleged that Saxena pressured his employees to exchange demonetised notes worth ₹1,400 crore in 2016 when he was chairman of a government Khadi body. AAP demanded his resignation and arrest.

358.title: MP woman fights off tiger, saves 15-month-old son from its jaws
358.article_body: A woman in her 20s repeatedly hit a tiger with her bare hands to save her 15-month-old son in the Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh's Umaria district, officials said on Monday. The tiger, that had held the child by its jaws, later mauled the woman, who sustained a fracture to her neck. Some villagers reportedly chased away the tiger.

359.title: Messi, Mbappe, Neymar need to accept that they won't play all games: PSG coach
359.article_body: PSG coach Christophe Galtier said that the club's players, including Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbappe and Neymar, will have to sit out from the matches at times. "We play a lot, every three days, then every four days, then there is the World Cup. Everyone has to understand that they won't be able to play all the games," Galtier said.

360.title: Bihar teacher harasses student for rejecting proposal, made to do sit-ups
360.article_body: A video has gone viral from Bihar, which shows villagers forcing a teacher to do sit-ups after he proposed a girl student that he used to teach. According to reports, the girl took tuition from him and rejected his proposal when the accused made advances. The accused started eve-teasing and harassing her, following which he was made to do sit-ups.

361.title: Kenya's top court upholds William Ruto's election as president
361.article_body: Kenya's Supreme Court on Monday unanimously upheld the election of William Ruto as the country's president in the August 9 polls. Runner-up candidate Raila Odinga had challenged Ruto's victory in the top court, alleging ballot rigging and other irregularities. Two affidavits alleging tampering with polling station result forms were dismissed by the court as "double hearsay".

362.title: Aakash Chopra changes his Twitter DP in support of Arshdeep who got abused for catch drop
362.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra changed his Twitter DP to that of Arshdeep Singh's photo to support the Team India fast bowler, who got abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup. Earlier, the Indian government summoned executives of Wikipedia after Arshdeep's page information was changed to reflect an association with Khalistan.

363.title: 7 killed in Hungary after train collides with car
363.article_body: A train collided with a car at a level crossing in southern Hungary on Monday, killing all seven occupants of the car, local authorities said. According to police, the driver of the train was rushed to a hospital with minor injuries. The level crossing where the incident took place had no gate or electric signal, Hungary's state railway company said.

364.title: Delhi's historic Rajpath & Central Vista lawns renamed 'Kartavya Path' by govt
364.article_body: Centre on Monday announced that the Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area in New Delhi will be renamed 'Kartavya Path'. Rajpath is the boulevard that runs from the Rashtrapati Bhawan through Vijay Chowk and India Gate, National War Memorial to National Stadium. This comes days ahead of the scheduled reopening of the refurbished Central Vista on September 8.

365.title: PayU's acquisition of BillDesk for $4.7 billion approved by CCI
365.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved the $4.7-billion acquisition of payment gateway BillDesk by Prosus' PayU. It is said to be the largest acquisition in India's digital payments space. The acquisition was announced in August last year. With the deal, PayU will now operate in more than 20 markets.

366.title: Well done girls, you are so amazing: SRK on his team TKR winning women's CPL
366.article_body: Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan congratulated his team, Trinbago Knight Riders, for lifting the trophy of the Women's Caribbean Premier League on Sunday. "Every victory is special...but somehow this one for TKR women's squad is well, most special. Well done girls you are all so beautiful and amazing," SRK tweeted. Notably, the actor owns TKR and KKR cricket teams.

367.title: 2 killed in flash flood in Kerala, IMD issues red alert in 4 districts
367.article_body: Two persons, including an eight-year-old girl, died in a flash flood at Mankayam waterfalls in Kerala's Palode town on Sunday, said police. They were a part of a group of 10 people. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert in four districts including, Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Idukki, for Tuesday.

368.title: SpiceJet needs ₹2,000 crore to continue flying: Report
368.article_body: Budget carrier SpiceJet needs recapitalisation to keep flying and compete with existing and new airlines, industry watchers reportedly told Livemint. The airline has reportedly said that its board had approved raising up to ₹2,000 crore amid high fuel prices and depreciation of the rupee. Notably, SpiceJet on Wednesday posted a worse-than-expected net loss of ₹789 crore for the April-June quarter.

369.title: 4 including 4-yr-old electrocuted to death in Assam; 2 others hurt
369.article_body: Four persons, including a four-year-old child, were electrocuted to death in Assam's Hailakandi district on Sunday evening. According to police, the incident took place when the child touched a live electric wire fallen on the ground and his parents and neighbours rushed to save him, but also got electrocuted in the process. Two others have sustained injuries in the incident.

370.title: Kerala tattoo artist accused of rape, sexual assault reopens studio
370.article_body: Tattoo artist Sujeesh PS, who had been arrested on March 5 after several women accused him of sexual abuse and rape, has reopened his tattoo studio 'Inkfected' in Kerala's Kochi. At least six women filed sexual assault complaints against him after an 18-year-old girl, in an anonymous post on Reddit, alleged she was raped in the tattoo studio by him.

371.title: 'Baahubali' was very similar to 'Karan Arjun': Rakesh Roshan
371.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said in an interview that SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' was "very similar" to his 1995 film 'Karan Arjun'. "But it was presented on a bigger scale. Even...songs were larger-than-life and hence people were enticed," he added. "In...South, they're still sticking to rooted stories," he said, adding that Bollywood filmmakers have "drifted away from the roots of Indianness".

372.title: Hope we play like this only: Nawaz on Pakistan's 5-wicket win vs India
372.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz said he hopes that the team will continue to play as they performed in their five-wicket win against India in the Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022 on Sunday. Nawaz was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 42 runs and 1/25. Pakistan chased the 182-run target on the penultimate ball of the match.

373.title: 2 policemen injured in accidental firing at training centre in Himachal
373.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) and a Head Constable suffered injuries after a gun was accidentally fired at the Police Training College in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Sunday. The victims are instructors at the centre. "A bullet got stuck in a gun during firing training. The two instructors were trying to fix it when the weapon misfired," said an official.

374.title: Aditi Rao Hydari shares pic with Mani Ratnam on Teachers' Day, pens note
374.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari took to Instagram on Monday to share a picture with filmmaker Mani Ratnam on the occasion of Teachers' Day. She wrote, "Be curious, admit mistakes, learn, evolve...Know whom to listen to and what to absorb and what to discard!" "To every teacher I've had every step of the way, Happy Teachers' day," Aditi added.

375.title: Society chairman, a Dawood associate, is threatening us: Malad residents
375.article_body: Residents of a high-rise building in Mumbai's Malad have written to the police requesting a suo moto case against the society's chairman. The residents claimed chairman Sonu Jalan has been threatening them, insulting women and misappropriating society funds. Residents say they are afraid of filing a case by themselves as Jalan is allegedly a close associate of Dawood Ibrahim.

376.title: Prez Murmu walks down the podium to honour differently-abled teacher, video goes viral
376.article_body: While conferring National Awards to teachers on the occasion of Teachers' Day, President Droupadi Murmu walked down the podium to honour a differently-abled teacher. Sharing a video, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweeted, "This heartwarming gesture...is a sweet reminder of her humility, rootedness and compassion. President Murmu is an inspiration when it comes to ideal public values."

377.title: Rape survivor fails 'virginity test' in Rajasthan, fined ₹10 lakh by Khap Panchayat
377.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly tortured, beaten and forced to undergo a 'virginity test' on the first day of her marriage in Rajasthan's Bhilwara. A ₹10 lakh penalty was also imposed on the rape survivor by the Khap Panchayat after she failed the test. Despite knowing about the rape, the woman's father-in-law made her go through the humiliation, said police.

378.title: Waste dumped in Navi Mumbai mangroves rising: Activists to Maha CM
378.article_body: Environmentalists have written to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde about the waste accumulated in Navi Mumbai mangroves. The letter sought stringent penalties and imprisonment for repeat offenders stating that medical waste, including syringes, has been found in the mangroves. Environmentalists say despite a dozen NGOs working on clean-up drives, the amount of waste keeps increasing.

379.title: India hands over body of terrorist, who died of cardiac arrest, to Pak
379.article_body: The body of a fidayeen suicide attacker from PoK, who was captured by Indian Army during an infiltration attempt in Jammu and Kashmir, has been handed over to Pakistan. The 32-year-old terrorist, identified as Tabarak Hussain, was injured in Army firing during his infiltration attempt and later he died of cardiac arrest on Saturday. He's reportedly a trained Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist.

380.title: Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan to undergo MRI scan for right leg strain
380.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan will undergo a precautionary MRI scan today after sustaining a strain in his right leg during the five-wicket win over India in the Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022 on Sunday. The 30-year-old was reportedly shifted to a hospital soon after Pakistan’s last-over victory. Rizwan scored a match-winning 51-ball 71 against India.

381.title: My body made me beauty queen & mother, gotta love it both ways: Neha
381.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said people's opinion on her body doesn't upset her because it gave her "two amazing humans", daughter Mehr and son Guriq. "This body made me a beauty queen and this body made me a mother. I gotta love it both ways," she said. She added she wants to set "realistic standards for myself and everyone else".

382.title: PM Modi congratulates Liz Truss for being elected as UK's third woman PM
382.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated UK's Prime Minister-elect Liz Truss. "Confident that under your leadership, the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership will be further strengthened. Wish you the very best for your new role and responsibilities," PM Modi tweeted. Truss, UK's former Foreign Minister, was elected as UK's third woman PM on Monday after securing 81,326 votes.

383.title: President Murmu presents National Teachers' Award to 45 teachers
383.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday presented the National Teachers' Award to 45 teachers from across the country for their work in the education sector. The awards were presented during an event in Delhi on the occasion of Teacher's Day. President Murmu said science, research and innovation are the basis of development in today's knowledge economy.

384.title: Karnataka seer found dead at Guru Madiwaleshwar Mutt, suicide suspected
384.article_body: A seer of Karnataka's Sri Guru Madiwaleshwar Mutt was found dead inside the mutt in Belagavi district on Monday. Police suspect that he died by suicide. The seer was reportedly upset over a video in which two women were seen discussing the alleged cases of sexual assault in some mutts. His name was also mentioned in the video.

385.title: Punjab minister talks to Arshdeep's mother on phone after he gets abused, shares video
385.article_body: Punjab Sports Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer shared a video posted by AAP wherein he can be seen talking to pacer Arshdeep Singh's mother Baljit Kaur after he got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan. "Entire Punjab, entire nation is with...Arshdeep...When he returns, I will go with you to receive him from the airport," he told Baljit.

386.title: Pa Ranjith's best work: Rajinikanth on 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu'
386.article_body: Director Pa Ranjith took to Twitter and shared Rajinikanth's review for his film 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu'. He said Rajinikanth called the film his "best work in terms of direction, writing, casting, cinematography and music". Pa Ranjith said he was "extremely touched by" Rajinikanth's appreciation. 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu' starred Kalidas Jayaram, Kalaiyarasan Harikrishnan and others.

387.title: Delhi BJP MLAs seek dismissal of AAP govt, to meet Prez tomorrow
387.article_body: BJP leader Ramvir Singh Bidhuri has said that all BJP MLAs in Delhi will meet President Droupadi Murmu tomorrow and demand the dismissal of the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in the national capital. Bidhuri said they'll give a memorandum over the same to President Murmu. This comes amid a controversy over a CBI investigation into the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy.

388.title: New Data Protection Bill, IT Act to make online world more accountable: Vaishnaw
388.article_body: Electronics and Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said the government is coming up with a new version of the Data Protection Bill and the amendment to the IT Act 2000, known as the Digital India Act. "What we are looking at is making the online world more accountable for what is being published there," Vaishnaw said.

389.title: Man robbed of e-rickshaw at gunpoint by 4 suspects in Delhi
389.article_body: A man was robbed of his e-rickshaw at gunpoint by four suspects in north Delhi's Burfkhana Chowk on Monday. The victim, Sushil Kumar, was going to his home in Malkaganj when the incident happened, police said. The unidentified accused threatened Sushil with a country-made weapon. Notably, a case has been registered under sections 392, 397 and 34 of IPC.

390.title: Sood Charity Foundation fulfilling my dream of becoming teacher: Sonu
390.article_body: Sonu Sood said if he wasn't an actor, he would have been a teacher. He said his dream is now coming true with 'Sood Charity Foundation', which is helping many students to pursue education. Calling his mother his "favourite teacher", Sonu shared, "Since my mother was a teacher herself, there was no excuse for me to have secured less marks."

391.title: Forced population control measures can be dangerous: Jaishankar
391.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday said that he is against forced population control measures and that a move in that direction will have very dangerous consequences, as it can create gender imbalance. "The rate of growth of the Indian population is falling. The reason is education, social awareness and prosperity," he added.

392.title: Man stabs transgender wife for singing songs in public in Bihar
392.article_body: A man stabbed his transgender wife in Bihar after she went to sing celebratory songs at other people's houses, even after his objection, reports said. The accused beat her up initially, but later stabbed her three times in her stomach using a knife. The accused had also tried to convince his wife to leave her line of work, reports said.

393.title: SC to hear Amazon's plea against CCI's suspension of Amazon-Future deal
393.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear Amazon's plea against Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order to hold its approval for Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group's Future Coupons Private Limited (FCPL). The court has sought a reply from the concerned parties and will hear the case on September 19. Amazon moved the SC after NCLAT upheld CCI's decision.

394.title: No one has put gun on makers' head: Johar on charging big amount for judging shows
394.article_body: Karan Johar, who returned to television screens as the judge of 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', has reacted to reports of him charging a big amount for the reality show. "I don't think anyone gets what they don't deserve. No one has put a gun on their head. So whatever money I earn is for a reason," Johar said.

395.title: Can't permit this: Minister on distortion of Arshdeep's Wikipedia page
395.article_body: While addressing the distortion of Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh's Wikipedia page, after India's loss to Pakistan on Sunday, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said that no intermediary operating in India can permit this type of misinformation. The left-arm pacer faced trolling on social media after he dropped a catch in the dying embers of India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan.

396.title: 12-year-old girl bitten by stray dog dies in Kerala
396.article_body: Despite receiving three doses of the anti-rabies vaccine, a 12-year-old girl, who was bitten by a stray dog, has died at Kottayam Medical College in Kerala. She was on ventilator support after being bitten by the dog several times on August 14. Kerala Health Minister Veena George had ordered the setting up of a medical board to treat the girl.

397.title: Cyber frauds pose as Army men, cheat father-son of ₹2 lakh in Pune
397.article_body: Cyber criminals allegedly posing as senior Army officers cheated a father-son duo to the tune of ₹2 lakh in the Pune district recently, police said on Monday. The accused allegedly showed interest in the victims' property and asked them to transfer money to 'establish a contact', police said. They even showed fake identity documents to gain trust, police added.

398.title: 2 steal gold worth ₹1.24 cr from jewellery store in Mumbai, held
398.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly stealing gold ornaments worth ₹1.24 crore from a jewellery store in central Mumbai, police said on Monday. The accused had broken into the store between 2 pm and 5 pm on August 24 and escaped with 2.4 kg of gold ornaments, an official said. Six teams were formed to track them down.

399.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' to release on OTT in October: Reports
399.article_body: Aamir Khan had earlier stated that his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will premiere on OTT platform after six months of its theatrical release. Now, owing to its poor performance at the box office, the makers have reportedly decided to release 'Laal Singh Chaddha' on OTT on October 20. The film also starred Kareena Kapoor Khan in a pivotal role.

400.title: CM Shinde-led Sena is real Shiv Sena, it is with BJP: Amit Shah
400.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena is the real Shiv Sena and it is with the BJP. "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed the BJP after seeking votes on the names of Narendra Modi and Devendra Fadnavis. Time has come to show Thackeray his place," said Shah.

401.title: Pune minor girls, who left home due to father's drinking habit, found
401.article_body: Two girls aged 12 and 13, who went missing from Pune district's Maval tehsil, were found on the Panvel-Nanded train in Osmanabad, police said. The girls had gone to school on Saturday but did not return home. Police said the girls were fed up with their father's drinking habit and he used to beat them up.
